Comments/ Action Taken: Cases reported from Village Na-Ali, Thekaraguri PHC Chauldhuwa, Block Boginadi. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 27 blood samples were found negative for malarial infection (RD kit). All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Chikda,Cases reported from Ambavadi Primary School Ambavadi (Navi Vasahat), SC Ambavadi, PHC Block Dediyapada. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 10 blood samples collected at PHC Chikda were found negative for malaria. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Chikda,Cases reported from Ambavadi Primary School Ambavadi (Navi Vasahat), SC Ambavadi, PHC Block Dediyapada. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 10 blood samples collected at PHC Chikda were found negative for malaria. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Gunamanaglam, Taluk Palur. District investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 05 Serum samples sent to DHQH, result awaited. Fever survey done. Indoor and outdoor fogging and water chlorination done. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.Village/PHC/HSC RRT

Cases reported from Village Idayathavanai, HSC E. Meenakshipuram, PHC Surandai, Block Keelapavoor. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 7 Blood sample sent for testing Dengue, Typhoid, Lepto IVCZ-Hosur (Scrub Typhus to DPHL Tirunelveli Result Negative. House to house fever survey done. Mass cleaning and fogging done in the affected village. Bleaching powder and lime powder mixture (in 1:3 ratio) sprayed in the damp and moist surfaces and in the cattle sheds. Fever camp conducted in the same date of investigation and planned to continue for next 15 days. Fever patients referred to nearby PHC for inpatient care. Strict instructions to maintain Chlorination at 2 ppm. Pipeline checked for leakage and the same attended to. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Chikkahanumenahalli, PHC/CHC Alkapura, Taluk Gowribidanur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 01 blood sample collected sent to SSL for Dengue and chikungunya, result awaited. Larva survey and source reduction was done. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Chinnakattankudi, SC P. Kattankudi, PHC Gopalapuram, Block Aruppukottai. District RRT outbreak. House to house survey done. 05 serum samples sent to DPHL, Virudhunagar; 1 sample was positive for Typhoid. Theinvestigated the fever cases

Health education given.blood samples tested at CHC Borsad; 7 blood for culture; result tablets distributed.

Cases of fever reported from Village Mandal. PHC Motakondur, residential school for girls. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Poor quality of drinking water was the probable cause of outbreak. 06 blood samples collected for widal test and CBP; result awaited. 04 water samples collected for physical, chemical and bacteriological analysis and sent to regional lab KMC, Warangal; results awaited. All cases treated symptomatically Health education given to residential school staff and children regarding personal hygiene and environmental sanitation.

Larval surveys and source reduction activities done in the area. 21 blood smears tested for Malaria found negative. 20 serum samples sent to GMC Aurangabad for Dengue and chikungunya examination; result awaited. Cases of fever reported from Village Nauli, Block Jakholi. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. 10 blood samples sent to IDSP Referral Lab, GMC Srinagar. Out of this, 9 tested positive by Typhidot. Symptomatic treatment of all cases. Health education given for maintaining personal hygiene and isolation of cases.

Cases reported from Village Kudacha (Brahman Faliya), SC Kudacha, PHC Rakholi, Block Silvassa. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 23 serum samples sent to DPHL, Silvassa. 08 samples found titer positive in the suspected/probable cases. 05 stool samples for culture surveillance found no organisms. 05 water samples were nonpotable by H2S test. All cases treated symptomatically. IEC and health education regarding mode of transmission and precautions to be taken by local communities was done by the health staffs.

Cases of fever reported from Village Dizuvalley, BPHC Simonabasti, SC Dizuvalley. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Cases belonged to the Tea tribe community of Tea garden line with poor socio economic condition. 15 blood slides were negative for malarial parasite at Simonabasti BPHC. Two water samples from the Kachha Wells were tested for MPN in DPHL, IDSP, and Nagaon. Both water samples were nonpotable. Community awareness and IEC regarding health, hygiene, sanitation and prevention of VBDs was conducted.

Cases reported from Village/SC Arasakulam, PHC Mustakurichi, Block Kariyapatti. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Pipe line leakages were the possible cause of outbreak. 04 serum samples sent to DPHL Virudhunagar; 01 sample was positive for Typhoid culture. All cases treated symptomatically. Chlorination and disinfection of drinking water done. Relevant health education given.

Cases of vomiting with abdominal pain reported from Village Kodaikanal, Poombarai, Mattupatti, and Moongilkadu. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 08 serum samples sent to DPHL, DGL and IVCZ, Hosur; 02 samples were positive for Chikungunya, 02 for Leptospirosis and 03 for Typhoid. All cases were treated symptomatically. IEC for safe drinking water and maintaining personal hygiene was given in the community.

Cases of fever reported from Village Jurhotia16 Bogolijan8 Chinatoliah Buwalguri, SC Bogolijan, PHC:Boginodi. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Rapid Diagnostic test performed in 28 cases were negative for malarial parasite. Microscopic blood slide examination for malaria parasite was negative for malaria infection in all cases. All cases were treated symptomatically. Relevant health education given.

Cases reported from Village/HSC Satharasampatti, PHC Kallal, Block Sivaganga. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 5 serum samples sent to DPHL Sivaganga; 01 positive for Leptospirosis. Door to door fever Surveillance carried out to detect new fever cases. Anti- larval activities are carried out. Fogging operation done. All Water Sources are chlorinated. Removal of waste materials and source reduction activity. Health Education given to the public in that affected area regarding Safe Drinking water and Mass cleaning activities carried out in the affected village and nearby villages.

Cases reported from Village Melavalavoo Colony, HSC Melavalavoo, PHC Sekkipatti, Block Kottampatti. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Blood smears tested for malaria were negative, 04 serum samples sent to DPHL Madurai & Madurai Medical college; 1 Typhoid positive at DPHL Madurai and 1 Chikungunya positive at Madurai Medical college. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.
Cases reported from Jorhat Urban. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.
Cases reported from Jorhat Urban. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Konphung Katang, SC Lenglong Dikiuram, PHC Lenglong, and Block Tamenglong. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 17 Blood slides tested for Malaria by using RDT. Result Negative. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Konphung Katang, SC Lenglong Dikiuram, PHC Lenglong, and Block Tamenglong. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 17 Blood slides tested for Malaria by using RDT. Result Negative. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village GP. Batibari GP, Kamalasagar GP And Kunaban GP under Madhupur, PHC Under Sepahijala. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All the Fever cases were tested for Malaria and found negative. All age group were affected. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village GP. Batibari GP, Kamalasagar GP And Kunaban GP under Madhupur, PHC Under Sepahijala. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All the Fever cases were tested for Malaria and found negative. All age group were affected. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Lakrihar, HSC Barmasia, PHC/Block Dharahra. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 24 Blood samples tested by RDT of which PF-9, PV-1, Fever survey done. DDT spray done by health workers in affected area. All cases treated locally. Source reduction activities undertaken. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Hanjihalli, PHC/CHC/Block Alur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 7 Blood sample send to Referral lab found positive for Typhoid by Culture and 2 water samples for MPN. Lab results are negative for Rickettsial infection and Brucellosis. And results awaited for Dengue, Typhoid and Leptospirosis. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Bhandora, SC Butida, PHC Katkumbh, Block Chikhaldara. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 17 Blood Serum sent to Sentinal Lab Yeotmal For Chikanguniya Result – Awaited. IEC done. Containers with larvae breeding were emptied Temephos applied. Control measures for vector breeding were initiated.

Cases reported from Village Kajra, Piprayan, Lotni, PHC/Block Majhgawan, Birsingpur, Karigohi. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Blood samples were tested by RDK of which 03 Positive PV and 18 positive for PF. Blood smear examination results awaited. NVBDCP Team and Block Team Visited to effected area and House to house survey was done, Active fever survey was done, IEC was done. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Gharmora PHC/ Block MPHC: Gharmora, BPHC Boginodi. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Microscopic blood slide examination for malaria parasite was done in all 62 fever cases and found negative for malarial infection. District RRT members have visited the spot on 02-11-2018 and investigated the outbreak. Active Surveillance was done by the paramedical staff. All patients treated symptomatically. Awareness camp was organized in the affected areas on 02-11-2018. All cases treated symptomatically.

Cases reported from Village Vhannur, SC Vhannur, PHC K Sangaon, Block Kagal. District RRT outbreak. House to house survey done. Out of 17 water samples collected 6 samples were not potable. 8 stool and 8investigated the

Cases reported Mettukundu, PHC Avudiyapuram, Block Virudhunagar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House survey done. Out of 5 blood samples collected and tested at DPHL Virudhunagar, 1 sample positive (Widal). Chlorination of water sources done. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.from Village Arasakudumbanpatti, SC to house for Typhoid

Cases reported from Village Halaga, PHC/CHC Yallur, Taluk Belagavi. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 2 blood samples sent to BIMS Belagavi and found negative for Enteric fever and 1 water sample tested and found unfit for drinking. Blood samples results are awaited. Chlorination of the drinking water sources done. Health education was given to community on personal hygiene.

Cases reported from Village/SC Hale Dharmapuri, PHC KN Halli. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 5 serum samples collected and were tested at DPHL Pennagaram were negative for Dengue, Chikungunya, Leptospirosis, Scrub typhus. Source reduction and fogging activities undertaken. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village/SC Hale Dharmapuri, PHC KN Halli. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 5 serum samples collected and were tested at DPHL Pennagaram were negative for Dengue, Chikungunya, Leptospirosis, Scrub typhus. Source reduction and fogging activities undertaken. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Health facility- Kohane TR, Akola, Ahmednagar District. Cases presented with fever, cold and cough. District RRT investigated the outbreak. After visiting School all students who had consumed cold drinking water were found to have symptoms. All students are stable now. Health education was given to practice isolation and COVID appropriate behavior.

Cases reported from Ward 14, Chemmanthitta Subcentre, Moothedam PHC, Block Chungathara, District Malappuram. Cases presented with fever, abdominal pain and headache. All cases presented with symptoms after consumption of welcome drink (lemon juice) in a marriage function. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Suspected source of infection was well water of the house which was located near a septic tank. Three blood samples were collected and sent to GMCH Manjeri. Eight cases were found positive for Typhoid by Widal tube test. Chlorination of well water was advised. Health education was imparted on the importance of food hygiene, safe drinking water and sanitation.

Cases reported from Village Tedga & Mapur Block Batouli, District Surguja. Case presented with complaints of high-grade fever, bodyache, headache. All 18 serum samples collected sent to CHC Bataouli and results came negative for Malaria, Typhoid and Covid. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team.

Cases reported from Village Amgasi Block Lakhanpur, District Surguja. Cases presented with high grade fever, bodyache and headache. Blood samples of all 6 patients sent for Widal and covid. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All samples came negative. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team.

Cases reported from Village Amgasi Block Lakhanpur, District Surguja. Cases presented with high grade fever, bodyache and headache. Blood samples of all 6 patients sent for Widal and covid. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All samples came negative. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team.

Cases reported from Durtlang Mel-5 locality, Aizawl District. Cases presented with Fever, Fatigue, Bodyache, Headache. Two water samples were sent to State Food Testing Laboratory Zemabawk. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Water samples showed presence of Staphylococcus aureus, Escherichia coli, Bacillus Ceres and Pseudomonas sps. ORS distribution, chlorination of water done. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on food hygiene, safe drinking water and sanitation.

Cases reported from Kot block, district Pauri Garhwal. Cases presented with symptoms of fever for < 7 days. After that the RRT team went to the village to investigate all the suspected cases. In which investigation team took blood samples of all those 25 suspected cases which were found negative after the fever profile test (typhido, malaria antigen, IgM ELISA, etc.). After the complete investigation of suspected cases, no complication was found in them. The team instructed the villagers to take proper health safety measures, wear masks and live in hygienic conditions and also instructed them to take boiled water for drinking purpose and hand washing before eating and after toilet.

Cases reported from Block Gunderdehi Village- Khuteri Rang. Cases presented with fever. 14 water samples and 174 blood slides were sent to PHE Balod & Block Gunderdehi. All water samples were found potable and blood samples were found negative. District RRT investigated the outbreak Door to door survey done. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on the importance of food hygiene, safe drinking water and sanitation. Health camp were organized.

Cases of fever reported from UPHC Mariswamy mutt limits, Ballari taluk, Ballari district. Cases presented with symptom of fever. 5 blood & 5 water samples were collected and sent to DPHL Ballari. 4 out of 5 water samples were reported as NSPP (not suitable for potable purpose). All blood culture results showed growth of salmonella typhi. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on the importance of food hygiene, safe drinking water and sanitation. IEC on Water borne diseases, pamphlet distribution in the construction site and Hand washing Techniques are been inculcated in the migratory population. The affected age group is in between 5-40 years.

Cases reported from Village 7th ward, PHC- CHC Mariswamy Mutt UPHC, Taluk Ballari. Cases presented with fever and myalgia. 5 water samples & 5 blood samples tested at DPHL Ballari. Blood culture showed salmonella typhi in 1 sample. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given. The most affected age group was children under 5 years of age.

Cases reported from Village Varantharapilly, Taluk Varantharappilly, District Thrissur. Cases presented with fever, vomiting and loose stools. Four stool samples and one water sample were collected and sent to Dept. of Microbiology lab Thrissur. Two stool samples came positive for the Salmonella typhi on culture and sensitivity. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Age? Case was reported from Dist. Amreli, Taluk Babra, Village Chamardi. Case presented with symptoms of anorexia, nausea, vomiting, and epistaxis. Blood Sample was collected and sent to NIV Pune for further investigation by PDU Medical Collage, Rajkot, which was found to be positive for CCHFV by RT PCR. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on safe animal handling, personal hygiene and safe drinking water. House to House survey was done and total 40 close contacts were detected, all were found to be asymptomatic. Residual Spray was done on shed/houses. Alphacypermethrin was sprayed on Animals for tick-eradication.

Case was reported from Dist. Amreli, Taluk Savarkundla (Urban). Case presented with symptoms of fever, chill and headache, abdomen pain. Blood Sample was taken from Sir T Hospital, Bhavnagar and sent to NIV Pune, which was found to be Positive for CCHFV by RT PCR. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on safe animal handling, personal hygiene and safe drinking water. House to House survey was done and close contacts were detected during Contact Tracing, all were found to be asymptomatic. Residual Spray was done on shed/houses. Alphacypermethrin was sprayed on Animals for tick-eradication.
Cases Reportedfrom A/P Kurundwad, ZP Dispensary Kurundwad, Taluk Shirol. Cases presented with Only fever. 2 blood samples

Cases Reported from At. /Po. Keshalapar, PHC Samudrapur Kora, SC Mangrul. Cases presented with symptoms of Fever, weakness etc. 18 serum samples were sent to SSH Sevagram for dengue and chikungunya testing, which were found to be negative on ELISA. Two serum samples were sent to NIV Pune for other fever testing, out of which one was found to be chikungunya positive on ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community

Cases Reported From At. /Po. Sawargaonjire, PHC Kata, Block Washim. Cases presented with Only with Fever > 7 Days. Total 5 blood Samples were collected for dengue and sent to GMC Akola, all were found to be negative. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on dengue.

Cases Reported from At. /Po. Pimpri Kh, PHC Selubazar, Block Mangrulpir. Cases presented with Only Fever > 7days. Total 5 Serum Samples were collected & sent to GMC Akola, out of which 2 were found to be positive for dengue IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health

Cases reported from Javahar Navodaya School, Village Sili, PHC Kilvani, District Dadra and Nagar Haveli. Cases were students residing in dormitory type housing. Cases presented with only fever < 7 days. All 32 blood samples were collected and tested at the hospital, all tested negative for Dengue (IgM ELISA) and Malaria (peripheral blood smear). District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated at Vinoba Bhave Civil Hospital. Vector control measures were undertaken in the locality. IEC activities were done. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on VBD.

Cases were reported from Village Kapukunda, Sub-District Saraipali, District Mahasamund. Cases presented with loose stools and vomiting. 4 water samples and 1 stool sample were collected and sent to Hamar Lab District Hospital Pandari. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Stool sample showed growth of Salmonella typhi on culture and sensitivity. All water samples showed growth of Salmonella typhi. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Village Kamta, Sub- District Chandwa, District Latehar. Cases presented with fever & cough. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. Cases were of the age group of 6-70 years. All 36 samples were found negative for malaria on microscopy. Community awareness and health education was given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases reported from At./Po. Saidapur, PHC Madalmohi, Block Georai. Cases presented with symptoms of fever, body ache, headache & weakness. Five samples were collected and sent to District Priority Lab DH Beed, out of which 1 sample was found to be positive for dengue IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on dengue. Fever and container survey were conducted in the area and surrounding areas, and preventive and curative measures were taken. Daily entomological surveys were conducted. Fogging, source reduction were done. A total of 438 containers were examined, out of which 18 were found to be positive for larvae. Temiphos solution was added in 13 containers. A 2 year old male child died due to dengue.

Cases were reported from Govt Girl’s Hostel, Sub-District Dharampuri, District Dhar. Cases presented with dizziness, nervousness and headache. 6 blood samples were collected and sent to CHC Dhamnod. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. 2 out of 6 samples came positive for Typhoid by Widal test. Age group of the affected cases were 15-17 years. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases reported from MG University Hostel, Athirampuzha, District Kottayam. Cases presented with fever, with generalized weakness. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. 2 blood samples came negative for Dengue NS1 by RDT kits at a Private lab (Hytech lab Palariyattom). Total 14 breeding sites were found in the campus. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Village Chauka, Sub-District Aurangabad, District Aurangabad. Cases presented with fever. Total 15 blood samples sent to GMCH Aurangabad. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. All samples found negative for Dengue NS1 by ELISA. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation. 11-year-old female died on 13-09-2023.

Cases reported from Gollarahatti and B Basavanahalli Villages, K Bidare SC, Singatagere PHC, Kadur Taluk, Chikkamagaluru District. Cases presented with symptoms of fever. Two blood samples were sent to DPHL Chikkamagaluru & HIMS Hassan, all were found to be negative for Dengue, Malaria and MR. Four water samples were also tested, all were found to be SPP (suitable for potable purpose). District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on hygiene, and sanitation. IEC regarding Fever, water borne disease and vector borne diseases were given.

Cases reported from Sub-District Gopalganj, District Gopalganj. Cases presented with symptoms of fever with weakness. Total 10 blood samples were collected and sent to Sadar Hospital, Gopalganj, out of which 6 came positive for Salmonella typhi by Widal test. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases reported from Village/PHC Baragi, Taluk Gundlupet, District Chamrajanagar. A total of 03 water samples and 03 blood samples collected and sent to MMC Mysore; result awaited. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Bidanegere, PHC Yaliyur, Taluk Kunigal, District Tumkur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 03 blood and 02 water samples collected and sent to DPL; result awaited. House to House fever survey done. All cases treated symptomatically. Source reduction activities carried out. Vector control measures undertaken. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Deoli, Block Uniara, District Tonk. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Mosquito breeding observed in many pits in the area. 83 blood smears examined out of which 02 were positive for P Vivax. House to house fever survey done. Pyrethrum spray done and Guppy fish introduced in the area. Health education regarding personal protection given.

Cases of fevr with joint pain reported from Village Chinna Murukkampatti Ward No 13, HSC Vetharampatti, PHC Kambainallur, Block Morappur, District Dhramapuri. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All the cases treated symptomatically at District hospital. 06 cases were admitted and tested negative for dengue, chikungunya and typhoid. House to house survey done. Health education regarding personal protection and source reduction given.

Cases of Fever reported from Village /PHC Hitnal, Block/ District Koppal. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Consumption of contaminated water due to pipeline leakage could be the probable cause of outbreak. All age groups were affected. Out of 06 serum samples tested at VIMS Bellary; 3 samples were found to be positive for Typhoid IgM ELISA. 03 water sample sent to DSU laboratory; result awaited. Health camp was organized in the area and all cases treated symptomatically.ORS and chlorine tablets distributed. Health education regarding hygiene and sanitation given.

Cases of fever with joint pain from Village/SC Vazhavachanur , PHC Vanapuram , Block Thandrampattu , District Tirunannamalai, District RRT investigated the outbreak.08 blood smears examined at PHC Vanapuram and 3 blood samples were sent to Vellore MCH for chickungyunya; result awaited. All cases treated symptomatically.Anti larval and anti adult measures taken. Health education given.

Cases of fever with rash reported from Village Meremsai, HSC Katepara, Block Jaganathpur, District West Singhbhum. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Majority of cases were in 0-5year of age group.All 05 serum samples tested at Institute of Serology Kolkata were found to be negative for measles. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Nelvoy, HSC Palliyagaram, PHC Padalam, Block Madhuranthagam, District Kanchipuram. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. A total of 19 blood smears were tested and found negative for Malaria. Three serum samples sent to KIPM Guindy for Dengue testing; result awaited. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Pathlapur, HSC Bajitpur, PHC /Block /District Shekhpura. District RRT investigated the area. House to house survey done. Majority of cases were in 1-5 years age group. A total of 05 serum samples collected and sent to Patna Medical College Hospital; all were found to be negative for measles. One 36 year old female died due to the condition. All the cases were treated symptomatically. Health education given

Cases of fever with rash reported from Village Shyamrola, SC Chandanpur, Block Barabazar, District Purulia. District RRT investigated the area. Mostly adults were affected. A total of 06 serum samples were taken and sent to Institute of Serology Kolkata; result awaited. All cases were treated symptomatically .Health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village Vadagur, PHC Kembodi, Taluk /District Kolar. District RRT investigated the outbreak House to house fever survey done. A total of 16 smears were negative for Malaria, 2 water samples tested were nonpotable.

Cases reported from Village Vikhale, PHC Wathar Station, Taluk Koregaon, District Satara. District RRT investigated the outbreak A total of 5 serum samples sent to NIV Pune; result awaited. House to house fever survey done. Water tanks were dried. Fogging done in the area. Health education given regarding personal hygiene. Guppy fish introduced in water bodies.

Cases reported from Rosera, ward no 1,2,3 Muradpur, District Samastipur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done.. A total of 06 serum samples sent to PMCH Patna and all found negative for Measles and Rubella. All cases were treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Hallegollarahatti, SC Chilanahalli, PHC Hosakere, Taluk Madhugiri, District Tumkur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Source reduction activities carried out. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases of fever with rash reported from Villages Gangar, Osla and Pawani, PHC /Block Mori, District Chamoli. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All cases were more than 5 years of age. 07 Blood Samples collected and sent to HIHT, Jolly Grant, Dehradun, all samples tested negative for Measles. All cases were isolated and treated symptomatically. Vitamin A was given to all the cases. Health education given.

Cases of fever reported from urban area of District Rajouri. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Blood samples are positive for Widal test.All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village Yerasupally, SC Machunur PHC Nandimandalam CHNC Chenur, District Kadapa. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Spraying of pyrethrum and abate done. All cases treated symptomatically. All 10 serum samples tested at RIMS, Kadapa were found to be negative for Dengue. All 18 blood smears examined for malaria tested negative. Health education regarding source reduction and personal protection given.

Cases of fever with loose motion reported from Villages Pali, taluka Thane and Sattari, CHC Valpoi, District North Goa. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All blood samples sent to DPL at Goa Medical College Bambolim; tested negative for Widal, Hepatitis A, dengue & chikungunya. Stool samples tested negative for any pathogen.all the blood smears examined were found to be negative for malaria. One female aged 55 years and one male aged 50 years died due to the condition. All water samples were found to be potable. All cases treated symptomatically. Health regarding personal protection and safe drinking water given.

Cases of Fever reported from Village Gollarahatti SC Jodihochihalli PHC Nidaghatta Block Kadur District Chikkamagluru. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey in the affected area done. Both the samples tested at SIMS Shimoga were found to be positive for Typhoid fever. 02 water samples collected and sent to DSU Chikkamagluru were found to be non-potable. Chlorination done in all water sources. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases of fever with rash reported from Pipra Hatt District Supaul. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Majority of cases were more than 10 years of age. 05 samples sent to at PMCH Patna ;result awaited.. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Adpalli, SC Gogaon, PHC Porla, Block / District Gadchiroli. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever surveillance done. A total of 14 blood smears were examined, and all were found to be negative for malaria. All 07 serum samples sent to District Hospital Chandrapur, tested negative for dengue. Fogging done. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education was given.

Cases reported from Village Patna Kala, PHC Mohandra, Block Pawai, District Panna. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Majority of case were in 01-11 years of age.05 serum samples collected and sent to Medical College Bhopal and all the samples were found to be negative for measles. All cases treated symptomatically. Vitamin A administered. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Bhadsa, SC Manara. Block Purulia-I, District Purulia. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Majority of cases were in 0-5 year age group. 06 samples collected sent to BS Medical College Hospital, Bankura ; result awaited. Health camp organized in the area and all cases treated symptomatically. Vitamin A supplementation administered. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Balabasavanahalli, PHC Bramhasandra, Taluk Sir, District Tumkur District RRT investigated the outbreak.House to house survey done 03 blood samples collected and sent to DPHL Out of which 2 samples were found to be widal positive but culture negative. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Ekdara , PHC Agardanda, Taluka Murud, District Raigad. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Consumption of contaminated water could be the probable cause of the outbreak. All 32 Sample sent to Rural Hospital Murud were found to be WIDAL positive. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases of fever with rash reported from Village Pashim Bhadragaon, SC Bidyur, PHC Boitamari, District Bongaingaon. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Only 4 cases were immunized. Cases reported from Village Meherma, Thakurgangti, Chanda, Mahuarana, District Godda. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done. Cases reported from Mamring Sec. School, PHC Machong. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Majority of cases were above 10 years of age group. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Ammannagar, PHC/Block Thiyagadurgam, HSC Prthivemangalam. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Chlorination done and protected water supply ensured. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases of fever with joint pains reported from Village Hampapatna, PHC/CHC Magimavinahali, Taluk HB Halli. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 04 Blood samples collected and sent to VIMS Ballari for Chikungunya/Dengue and Typhoid fever; result awaited. 42 Blood smears were found to be negative for MP. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Wadwani, PHC Mamla. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. 05 blood samples collected for Dengue & Chikungunya;result awaited. All cases treated symptomatically.Source reduction activities undertaken. Health education given.

Cases of fever with rash & mild cough were reported from Village Chopra, Block Jakholi. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 03 Blood samples tested at Himalayan Institute Hospital Trust, Jolly Grant, Dehradun were found to be negative for Measles. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases of fever with rash reported from Village Majhagawan, PHC/Block Karkeli, SHCDhanwar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 2-10 years of age group. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from VKV Jirdin School, Aalo. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 16 blood slides tested were found to be negative for malaria. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Jirewadi, SC Koradgaon, PHC PagoriPimpalgaon, BlockPathardi. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 02 Serum samples were collected and sent to Sentinel Center, Ahmednagar; both samples were found to be negative for Dengue and Chickungunya. 14 Blood smears tested negative for malaria parasite. Entomological survey was done. (HI 9.83, BI 11.47, CI 3.7). All cases treated

Cases reported from MSP Police Camp, Malappuram, SC Municipality area, Block Pokkottur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 10 Blood samples tested for Chikungunya were found to be negative. 07 Samples sent to MCH Manjeri for IgM Elisa of Dengue &Chikungunya; result awaited. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village/HSC Eamanur, PHC Eriyur, Block Dharmapuri. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Source reduction, ant larval activities, fogging operation done, OHT chlorination done. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Pagadapady, HSC Vellaiyur, PHC Veeraganur, Block Thalaivasal. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 4 serum samples sent to DPHL Salem, 4 samples positive for WIDAL, 2 samples positive for Chikungunya and 1 sample positive for Leptospirosis. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village/HSC Kailavaram, PHC Theerthamalai, Block Harur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 5 serum samples sent to IVCZ Hosur, & District Public Health Lab, Pennagaram, Dharmapuri Result 3 Typhoid Positive, 2 Chickungunya & Typhoid Positive, 2 Chickungunya equivocal, 1 Dengue Positive. Fogging and antilarval activities done, OHT chlorination done. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Addur, PHC/CHC Ganjimatt, Taluk Mangalore. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 2 Blood culture have been sent to District public lab for Typhoid and found positive. Drinking water samples collected for water test and found unfit. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village/HSC/PHC T.Meenachipuram, Block Sedapatti. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 5 Serum samples sent to DPHL Madurai Result awaited. House to House Survey of Fever Cases done. Checked for Pipe Line Leakages. OHT Cleaning & Chlorination done. IEC & IPC done. Fogging, Mass Cleaning & Disinfection done. Advised to drink boiled Water. Medical Team camp conducted. Disinfection of cattle sheds done. All Breeding sources destroyed. Fogging done. AL Work done. Nilavembu Kudineer distributed.

Cases reported from Village Veeralampatti, HSC S.Kottaipatti, PHC/Block Sedapatti. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 1 water sample and 5 serum samples sent to DPHL Madurai Result awaited. House to House Survey of Fever Cases done. Checked for Pipe Line Leakages. OHT Cleaning & Chlorination done. IEC & IPC done. Fogging, Mass Cleaning & Disinfection done. Advised to drink boiled Water. Medical Team camp conducted. Disinfection of cattle sheds done. All Breeding sources destroyed. Fogging done. AL Work done. Nilavembu Kudineer distributed. Mass Cleaning done. Area under surveillance. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Kuruva, HSC Pazhamalloor, PHC Pang, Block Mankada. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Cases had history of consuming food in a marriage. 27 Lab samples collected and found positive by Widal test. 1 blood sample tested positive for Typhoid by culture and tested at MCH Manjeri. Mass chlorination conducted in the affected areas. 134 wells chlorinated. 1312 chlorine tablets distributed. Group talks and Health education class conducted. IEC materials supplied. All cases treated symptomatically.

Cases reported from Village Devsar and Sopat Block Qazigund. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Symptoms were fever with general body aches, chills. All affected patients are in the age group of 09 years - 50 years. All patients are being treated at PHC Devsar. 02 water samples from village Devsar and 02 water samples from village Sopat have been collected for analysis and sent to IDSP Provincial Lab, Barzulla Sgr, reports awaited. People were advised to use boiled water for drinking proposes and dispose the sanitary waste properly. Health advisory regarding Enteric Fever in the form of Pamphlets were distributed and also pasted on walls at public places.

Cases reported from Village Deshnoor Village, 04th Ward, PHC/CHC Bagewadi, Taluk Siruguppa. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 06 Blood Serum samples collected and sent to VIMS, Ballari and 02 Water Samples collected result awaited. 26 blood smears examined for Malaria Parasite, result awaited. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given. Larval surveillance started in the area.

Cases reported from Village Melendhal, SC Mithilaikulam, PHC Kaloorani, Block Thiruchulli. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Out of 5 serum samples collected and sent to DPHL, Virudhunagar: 2 samples were positive for Typhoid. 5 water samples collected and sent to DPHL, Virudhunagar were nonpotable. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village/HSC Adagapadi, PHC Solaikottai, Block Dharmapuri. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 2 serum samples sent to DPHL Dharmapuri; result awaited. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from a jail in Chitradurga Urban, PHC/CHC Buddanagara UPHC, Taluk Chitradurga. District RRT investigated the outbreak and visited the jail and examined jail inmates. 3 Blood samples, 47 Blood smears collected and sent to DPHL Chitradurga, all found negative for Dengue, Chikungunya and Typhoid. Jail authorities were asked to undertake vector control activities. Health education given.

Cases reported from Chhowkham Town, CHC Chhowkham. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Out of 18 blood samples collected sent to CHC Chowkham; 15 blood samples were positive for widal test. 40 water samples collected were potable. Symptomatic treatment given to cases. Health education given regarding safe drinking water and sanitation.

Cases reported from Village Tuglakabad (Churiya Mohalla, Kumhaar Mohallah, Kangar Mohalla), PHC Kangar Nohallah, Block Churiya Mohallah. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 43 blood samples were collected were positive for Typhi dot test (ELISA). 13 blood sample collected and sent to Pt Madan Mohan Malviya; result awaited. Water samples collected and sent to Delhi Jal Board showed presence of ammonia confirming sewage contamination and the samples were bacteriologically unsatisfactory. All cases treated symptomatically. Food safety officer instructed to collect water samples from the water supply and shops for testing. Chlorine tablets were distributed in the community. Health education given safe drinking water and personal hygiene.

Cases reported from Village PHC/CHC Bageshpura, Taluk Arasikere. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 5 blood samples for Dengue, 3 blood samples for Typhoid culture collected, result awaited. All cases symptomatically. Health education given.Ramji halli, treated

Cases reported from Village Angarjun, SC Rongpur IV, BPHC Udharbond. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All cases treated symptomatically. Awareness regarding mosquito control activities done by health workers. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Gayanchuk, Phultol, Da Gharphalia, Kapilachuk, SC Kapilachuk, BPHC Bhogamukh. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 32 blood slides collected were negative for malaria parasite. All cases treated symptomatically. Awareness regarding vector borne, water borne diseases was done. Health education given.
Cases reported from Village Gaon, Sowguri Gaon, Goriasapori

Cases reported from Village Tasku-A, Block Jirang. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to House survey done. Blood samples collected and send to State Referral Lab; result awaited. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Kasturba Gandhi School, under SC Motum, Block Mebo. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 18 blood samples were collected and all found negative for Dengue and JE tested at DPHL Pasighat. Necessary advice for prevention and control in terms of IEC has been imparted to the school teachers and patients. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Kasturba Gandhi School, under SC Motum, Block Mebo. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 18 blood samples were collected and all found negative for Dengue and JE tested at DPHL Pasighat. Necessary advice for prevention and control in terms of IEC has been imparted to the school teachers and patients. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village/PHC/CHC Pattanayakanahalli, Taluk Sira. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 2 serum samples taken and found negative for Dengue and Chikungunya, 1 blood sample was subjected to culture and yielded no growth after 72 hours, result for chicken pox is awaited. All samples were sent to DPHL Tumkur. House to house survey done. IED done.

Cases reported from various villages of PHC Rangapara. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All cases treated. 4 blood samples collected and sent to DPHL Darrang for Culture for Typhoid, result awaited. 5 water samples collected and sent to SRL, IDSP, TMCH, Tezpur, Sonitpur for bacteriological examination, Result awaited. Awareness done in the affected area. Source reduction activities undertaken. Health education given.

Cases reported from NTPHC Pingleena, Village Pingleena. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases had history of fever of more than one week. 2 blood samples for blood culture was taken and sent to PHL JLNM hospital Sri nagar, result awaited. 2 water samples collected and sent to PHL JLNM hospital Sri nagar result awaited. All cases treated. Health education given.

Cases reported from SC Kunpalsar, PHC Ridi, Block Shri Dugargarh. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases presented with fever, headache, fatigue, cough and abdominal pain. 9 blood samples and 2 water samples sent to SPMC Bikaner, result awaited. Active fever survey done in the area. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

reported. 42 blood samples were collected and all treated symptomatically.Cases reported from Village Deomali, CHC Deomali. District RRT investigated the outbreak Cases of Fever with weakness found positive by Widal test at CHC Deomali. Majority of cases were in 7-15 year age group. Necessary advice for prevention and control in terms of IEC has been imparted. All cases

Cases reported from Village Sonari, SC Dharangaon, PHC Takli Brahamangaon, Block Kopergaon. District RRT investigated the outbreak. In entomological survey, out of 190 containers, 3 found positive for larva. HI-6.66, CI-1.57, BI-

Cases reported from Village Matihanwa Tola- Dudharwa, Block-Brijmanganj PHC Bahaduri. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All blood slides collected were negative for malaria. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Salganga, Champatila & Tikolparghat, SC Salganga, BPHC Udharbond. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 19 RDT and 12 Blood slides collected and sent to Udharbond BPHC and all found negative for Malaria. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.
Cases Healthreported from Village Takya Batpora, PHC/Block Kunzer. District RRT investigated the outbreak. The water treatment plant supplied contaminated water to the affected area. 2 water

Cases reported from Polanayakanahalli, PHC Kencharlahalli, Taluk Chintamani. District RRT investigated outbreak. Lab samples collected and result awaited. Mosquito density has been reported as high in the area. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Boasimla Town under PHC Boasimla, Block Raga. District RRT investigated the outbreak. A total of 29 blood samples were collected and sent to PHC Boasimla out of which 19 were positive for Typhoid by Widal test. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Chandralahalli, PHC Beechaganahalli, Taluk Gudibande. District RRT investigated outbreak. Larval survey done. Lab samples collected and result awaited. All cases treated. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Sonapur CHC Baruhabari. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Cases consumed well water and presented symptoms with fever, loss of appetite and bodyache. 11 serum samples collected; 8 samples were positive for Typhoid by widal test. 2 water samples collected; result awaited. Symptomatic treatment given. Health education given regarding personal hygiene and sanitation.

Cases reported from Boasimla town under PHC Boasimla, Block Raga. District RRT investigated the outbreak. A total of 29 blood samples were collected and 19 were found positive for Widal test. All cases were treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Shettikere, PHC Thimmasandra, Taluk Sidlaghatta. District RRT investigated the outbreak. A total of 02 serum samples were collected and sent to DPHL Lab. 02 water samples were collected and tested by H2S media, result awaited. All cases were treated symptomatically. No larva was found indoor or outdoor. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village/HSC Vijayakarisalkulam, PHC Thayilpatti, Block Vembakottai. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases presented with fever, headache, cough and cold. Cases belonged to age group 1-14 years, both boys and girls were affected. A total of 08 serum samples were collected and tested at DPHL Virudhunagar; 03 samples were positive for typhoid and 01 positive for typhoid and leptospirosis. Pipeline leakages were observed at 5 points which could be the probable source of infection. All cases were treated symptomatically. Medical camp conducted at school and village. House to house survey conducted. Mosquito and larva control measures undertaken. Water chlorination done. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Old Bagbahar, SC Borjelenga, BPHC Dholai. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Blood sample collected for PSMP were negative for Malaria parasite. All cases were treated symptomatically. Fever surveillance conducted in the area. Heath education given.

Cases reported from Village Clubtilla, SC Borjelenga, BPHC Dholai. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Rapid Diagnostic Kit used at field level in 6 cases and found negative for Malaria. Blood sample collected for PSMP from 11 cases and all were negative. All cases were treated symptomatically. Fever surveillance conducted in the area. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Kamranga pt I, SC Kamranga II, BPHC Harinagar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Rapid Diagnostic Kit used at field level for detection of Malaria in all 15 cases and found negative. Blood sample was collected from all 15 cases for PSMP and found negative. All cases treated symptomatically. Fever surveillance conducted. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village N. Jamuguri Bordikorai HWC Khokonbasti, Agarguri and Bordikorai. Block HIRU. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases presented with fever, cases were distributed across all age group and both men and women were affected. Case specific investigation done. Blood sample collected from all cases for PSMP and found negative. All cases were treated symptomatically. Health education given with reference to Vector Borne Diseases.

Cases reported from Village Gohpur Lohitmukh, various SHC’s under Block HIRU. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases presented with fever and poor appetite, few cases also complained of headache and pain abdomen. Cases were distributed across all age groups. Blood sample was collected from all cases and found positive for WIDAL. Of the 195 cases 05 blood samples were collected and sent to DPHL, IDSP, Darrang for confirmation of typhoid and found negative. A total of 05 water samples collected sent to Microbiology Dept. TMCH for MPN test and found unsatisfactory for drinking. Blood culture showed no significant growth. All cases were treated symptomatically. Health education given on water borne diseases, hand washing and personal hygiene.

Cases reported from Under Samdong, PHC SAP Camp Pangthang East Sikkim. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases presented with high fever, joint pain, nausea followed by dysentery. A total of 145 trainees were screened by a medical team and 43 were diagnosed as viral fever and 03 as Acute Gastroenteritis. A total of 07 nasopharyngeal swab samples were collected and tested at NICED Kolkata and 02 samples tested positive for Influenza A(H3N2), 01 sample found positive for Influenza B the remaining 04 samples were negative. A total of 02 water samples were collected one each from main line and dining hall and tested at MS STNM, Hospital (DPHL), the sample from main line was found unsatisfactory for drinking and one from dining hall (aqua guard) was satisfactory for drinking. All cases were treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Bhitri, Post Talwarpur, CHC/Block Trivediganj. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All cases were treated symptomatically. Unhygienic environment and water logging was observed. Health education given.
CCHF (IgM ELISA) and collected and sent negative for CCHF. Animal Husbandry

Cases of fever, headache, myalgia, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea reported from Village Timbada, SC Khambhada, PHC Salanpur, Block Barwala. Central, State and District RRT investigated the outbreak. All the 2 serum samples collected and sent to NIV, Pune; were positive for both CCHF (RT- PCR) and CCHF (IgM ELISA). One death occurred in a 45yr old female. 10 blood samples of contacts were collected and sent to NIV, Pune; 1 sample was found positive for CCHF. Animal Husbandry team collected; 5 cattle samples and sent to NIV, Pune; 2 blood samples were found positive for CCHF. Entomological survey done and 5 tick pool samples were collected and sent to NIV, Pune; all samples were found negative for CCHF. Cases were treated symptomatically. Anti-tick measures were carried out in the affected area. De- ticking of cattle was done. Deltamethrin spraying done in the affected area.

Cases of fever, headache, myalgia, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea reported from Village Zamadi, PHC Boradi, Block Limadi. Central, State and District RRT investigated the outbreak. Initially two cases 55yr old and 75yr old female were reported RT-PCR and (IgM ELISA) positive at NIV Pune, both of them died during the course of illness. 13 blood samples of contacts were collected and sent to NIV, Pune; 1 sample was found RT-PCR positive for CCHF. Animal Husbandry team collected; 9 cattle samples and sent to NIV, Pune; 2 blood samples were found positive for CCHF. Entomological survey done and 9 tick pool samples were collected and sent to NIV, Pune; all samples were found negative for CCHF. Cases were treated symptomatically. Anti-tick measures were carried out in the affected area. De-ticking of cattle was done. Deltamethrin spraying done in the affected area.

Cases reported from Maruwary Maternity Hospital. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases presented with acute onset fever, loss of appetite and cough. A total of 27 serum samples were collected and tested for Widal and culture, and all 27 were Typhoid positive by Widal, culture showed no significant growth. All cases were treated symptomatically. Health education given. PHE Dept was informed to take necessary actions.

Cases reported from Village Kamlej, PHC Fairadka, Block Bhavnagar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases presented with high grade fever and headache. The deceased was a 40 year old female. A total of 18 human serum samples, 06 animal blood samples and 06 tick samples collected and sent to NIV Pune. 02 blood samples were found positive for CCHF by RT PCR. Cases treated symptomatically. Health education given. Insecticide spraying over animals and households, deltaforce liquid for washing animals, Malathion+lime powder dusting in 109 houses with domestic animals by Animal husbandry department.

Case reported from Village Nana Sagadiya, SC/PHC Salpipallya, Block Padhhari. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Case presented with fever. A total of 03 serum samples were collected and sent to NIV Pune and 1 found positive for CCHF. Active case search done. A total of 03 close contacts were found and monitored for any symptoms. Deticking of livestock was done by Veterinary department. Indoor residual spraying done in the affected area. Health education given.

Case reported from Village Datretiya, SC Malapara, PHC Patna, Block Vallabhipur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Case presented with high grade fever and headache, domestic animal and castles was observed in the household. A total of 05 serum samples collected and tested at NIV Pune; 01 was positive for CCHF by RT PCR. Case was treated symptomatically. Tick control measures in animals was done by Animal husbandry department. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Durga Sheety Colony, PHC/CHC Ayodyanagar, Taluk Hubballi. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases presented with fever, headache, loss of appetite and generalized weakness. The source of infection was probably contaminated water. A total of 11 serum samples tested at KIMS, Hubballi; 01 was Widal positive. Blood culture was negative. A single water sample was collected for MPN testing was non potable. All cases were treated symptomatically. Chlorination done. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village West Sanarapalayam, PHC P. Kasipalayam, SC Vaipadi. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 04 serum samples collected and sent to DPHL Erode; 03 samples found positive for Typhiod. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Case reported from Village Sandhkhakhara, SC Shivendranagar, PHC Mangadh, Block Gariyadhar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Case presented with mild fever and nausea. A single human sample and 05 animal samples were collected and tested at NIV Pune; human sample found positive for CCHF. Animal sample result awaited. Indoor Malathion + lime powder dusting done in the affected area. Animal husbandry department has taken necessary action for containment. ICDP store has been made functional in the affected area for providing insecticides for tick control by Animal husbandry department. Case was treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village/SC Chaan, CHC Bahranda Khurd, Block Khandar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Fever and larval survey conducted in the area. A total of 28 blood samples were collected and 11 positive for Dengue NS1 ELISA, 03 Chikuingunya 01 for Scrub Typhus. A total of 15 throat swab samples collected and 03 were positive for Croynebacterium. A total of 570 blood slides sample collected and 02 samples positive for Plasmodium vivax and 03 were positive for Plasmodium vivax by RDT. A total of 05 swab samples collected and sent to CMC Vellore for confirmation, result awaited and 38 blood slides collected for cross verification at SRD, Jaipur. All cases were treated symptomatically. Diphtheria cases shifted to isolation ward at District Hospital. Immunization session conducted in the affected area. Entomological survey revealed HI 35, BI 52 Health education given.

Case treated from Village Dadava Randal, PHC Devgam, Taluk Kunkavav. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active cases search done. Case presented with high fever and vomiting. A single serum sample collected and tested at NIV, Pune was found to be positive for CCHF by Real time RT PCR and Anti-CCHFV IgM ELISA. Case was treated symptomatically. ORS and chlorine tablets distributed in the affected area. Tick eradication, indoor residual spray and other vector control measures taken. Health education given on water, milk and food hygiene and sanitation measures.

Cases reported from Village Special Category Residential School, PHC/CHC Nazarbad, Taluk Mysur Urban. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Area surveyed for leakage in water pipelines and breeding sites. Turbidity observed in water used for cooking in hostel. History of exposure to infection from outside students present. One case was positive for Salmonella typhi on culture. A total of 03 blood samples and 02 water samples collected and tested at DSU, Mysuru, result awaited. All cases treated. Health education given on safe drinking water and food hygiene.

Casereported Bhavnagar MC. District RRT Active case search done. The case was engaged in taking care of domestic animals, he has 02 cows in his residence. A single serum sample collected and tested at NIV Pune, was positive for CCHF by Real time RT PCR. A total of 05 animal and 05 Tick samples were collected; result awaited. Case symptomatically. Anti Animal husbandry department. A total of 12 close contacts have been kept under observation. Health education given.

Case reported from Village Pipalva, SC Juni Sakdi, PHC Jetalsar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey conducted. The deceased was a 65y/M who had contact with livestock, during which he was probably bitten by tick and was also a K/C/O NIDDM. The samples were tested at NIV, Pune; it was positive for anti CCHF IgM ELISA, urine sample was negative. Anti tick measures taken by Health and Animal husbandry department. A total of 03 close contacts were kept under observation. Health education given on disease prevention.

Cases reported from Village Karattur, HSC Sangampatty, PHC Veeramachanpatty, Block Thuraiyur. District RRT investigated the outbreak.A total of 04 Serum and 04 water samples collected and sent to DPHL Trichirapalli, result 02 Leptospirosis positive and 01 sample Typhoid positive. All cases treated. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Marathe, PHC Lasur, Block Chopda, District Jalgaon. 13 Blood smears and 13 Blood serum samples were sent to GMC Aurangabad for further lab analysis, out of which all tested negative for Dengue and Chikungunya. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given. Fogging was carried out in the affected area.

Cases reported from Village Marathe, PHC Lasur, Block Chopda, District Jalgaon. 13 Blood smears and 13 Blood serum samples were sent to GMC Aurangabad for further lab analysis, out of which all tested negative for Dengue and Chikungunya. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given. Fogging was carried out in the affected area.

Outbreak of fever with cough and vomiting reported from Village Katihatti, SC Chikkabyaladkere, PHC G.N.Kere, Block Hosadurga, District Chitradurga. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Cases treated at local health centre. All 23 blood smears examined, tested negative for malaria. 5 serum samples collected which tested negative for Dengue. Control measures undertaken. IEC done.

Outbreak of fever with joint pain and myalgia reported from Village Chinnapalam, SC Tharavaithoppu, PHC Pamvan, Block Mandapam District Ramanathapuram. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Cases treated at local health centre. All 17 blood smears examined tested negative for malaria. 4 serum samples collected and sent to DPL (IDSP) Ramanathapuram which tested negative for Dengue. Anti-larval activities and fogging done in the affected area.

Outbreak reported from Village/SC Devarpada, PHC Chinchohal, Block Malegaon, District Nashik. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Cases treated at local health centre. 18 serum samples collected and sent to Dhule Medical College, tested negative for Dengue. Entomological survey revealed; CI 11.2, HI 10.2, BI 13.3. Anti-larval activities and Pyrethrum spray done. IEC done.

Outbreak of fever with cough and sore throat for 7 days reported from Central Reserve Police Force Training School, Neemuch city, District Neemuch. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for fever cases done. Cases treated symptomatically. IEC done.

Cases reported from Village Orivayal, SC Maranthai PHC Melasirupothu, Block Kadaladi, District Ramanathapuram. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Cases treated at local health centre. 12 blood smears and 15 serum samples collected and sent to IVCZ Hosur and MMC Maduarai, result awaited. Anti-larval activities and fogging done in the affected area. IEC done.

Outbreak of fever with joint pain reported from Village Obleshettyhalli, PHC/CHC Hudem, District Bellary. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for fever cases done. Cases treated at local health centre. All 62 blood smears examined, tested negative for malaria. 10 serum samples collected; result awaited. Entomological survey revealed; HI 21.2%, CI 23.9%, BI 53.2%. Anti-larval activities and Pyrethrum spray done. IEC done.

Outbreak of fever with headache and back ache reported from Village Adarsh, PHC Jeshalpur, Block Nandod, District Narmada. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Active search for fever cases done. Cases treated at Civil Hospital Rajpipla. 2 serum samples collected and sent to SSG Vadodara; result awaited. IEC done.

Cases reported from Village Veerambal, SC Ilamchembur, PHC Melasirupothu, Block Kadaladi, District Ramanathapuram. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Cases treated symptomatically. 15 blood smears and 6 serum samples collected and sent to MMC Madurai; result awaited. Anti-larval activities and fogging done in the affected area. IEC done.

Outbreak of fever with arthalgia and myalgia reported from Village Chelliyapuram, SC Nathakulam, PHC/ Block Narikudi, District Virudhunagar. Active search for fever cases done. Cases treated at local health centre. 6 serum samples collected and sent to IVC&Z, Hosur; result awaited. Anti-larval activities and fogging done in the affected area.

Cases reported from Village Chinchondi, PHC Ambulga, Block Nilanga, District Latur. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Cases treated symptomatically. All 7 blood smears examined tested negative for malaria. Vector control measures undertaken. IEC done regarding preventive measures against vector borne diseases.

Cases reported from Village Korali, PHC Kasar Balkunda, Block Nilanga, District Latur. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Cases treated locally.
