More cases were reported from same area following which RRT visited the area and active survey was done. All fever cases were treated. Dry day was observed. Blood smears from 55 cases and were found to be negative for malaria. IEC to villagers and fogging done.

One death occurred on 24-05-2013 at Thane Kalwa Rajiv Gandhi Medical College. The cause of death was reported as dengue by Death Evaluation Committee of the hospital. Cases reported from Samatanagar (Urban), Manpada (UHP). Cases presented with fever. Active survey for cases and vector breeding done. High Vector density with HI - 8.84, CI - 12.22 and BI - 29.20. Indoor spraying conducted in 75 houses. Blood smears were collected from 7 cases and were negative for malaria. 4 serum samples tested negative for Dengue.

Cases of fever reported from Village Ganjaldhana, Block Seoni Malwa, District Hoshangabad. RRT investigated the outbreak. Larva breeding was found in stored water. Out of 14 slides tested, 1 slide was positive for P. vivax. Preventive measures taken. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Khamla, Block Killod, District Khandwa. District malaria team and block RRT investigated the outbreak. Most of the cases were children in the age group 5-14 years. Stagnant rain water and poor sanitation were found in the affected area. All cases tested negative for bivalent RDK for Pv & Pf. All 7 serum samples collected were found negative for Dengue. Treatment given. Preventive measures taken. IEC done.

Cases of fever, URI and myalgia were reported from Palpecelamdu Village, PHC Kadathur, district Dharmapuri. RRT investigated the outbreak. 3 out of 6 serum samples sent to Institute of Vector Control & Zoonosis (IVC & Z), Hosur were positive for Widal. Sanitation, hygiene and drinking water supply quality were found poor. Active survey done. Treatment given to those affected. Health education given to villagers.

Cases with loose motion, vomiting and fever reported from Village /SC Azaguri, PHC Khowang, District Dibrugarh. Medical team from PHC Khowang, AMCH and RRT visited the affected area. All age groups were affected. Two female children aged 7 & 10 years died. Open field defecation is common in the area. 7 stool samples tested by AMCH, Microbiology Department showed growths of Salmonella typhimurium, 9 water samples tested for MPN test were found unsatisfactory for drinking purposes. Chlorination done. IEC for personal hygiene, drinking water and sanitation given.

Outbreak of fever reported from Village /SC B C colony Tadimalla, PHC Tadimalla, Block Nidavolu, District West Godawari. RRT visited the affected area. Mosquito breeding sites were present in the affected area. Medical camp organized in the affected area. Door to Door fever surveillance done. Health education given regarding environmental sanitation, food sanitation, personal hygiene, water chlorination, prevention of mosquito bite, and dry day significance. Anti-larval operations conducted in the entire village with Abate. Chlorine tablets distributed. 13 year old female & 15 year old male died. 40 blood slides were examined, all were negative for malaria. 3 water samples were collected & sent to DPH lab, result awaited.

Cases of fever reported from Village Ramasingavaram, Sub-center Kuchimpudi, PHC Pedavegi, CHC Denduluru, District West Godavari. RRT investigated the outbreak. Poor sanitary conditions were observed in the affected area. Mosquito breeding sites were present. 38 blood samples collected, all were negative for malaria. 3 water samples were collected sent to DPH Lab, result awaited. All cases treated. Anti-larval & vector control measures taken. Chlorination of water done. IEC activities conducted.

13 suspected cases including 5 deaths were reported due to CCHF from Village Kariyana, Babra Taluka in District Amreli. State RRT and a team from NIV investigated the outbreak. All age groups and both sexes were affected. 6 cases were confirmed (2 deaths + 4 surviving) as CCHF by RT-PCR test at NIV, Pune. Several cattle, goats, sheeps were found positive for CCHF. Out of 8 pools of ticks, 2 pools (residence of index case) were found positive for CCHF. First reported case (90 years, male) occurred on 23/6/13 with fever, diarrhea, vomiting and bleeding Disorder. Last case reported on 10/07/13. Cases were treated at CHC Babra and referred to PDU Rajkot. Patients treated with Ribavirin in the hospital. All cases occurred among cattle grazing community living in houses with heaps of cow dung and other garbage nearby. Cattles were living along with human beings. The veterinary department has undertaken the Acaricidal treatment on 1668 cattle with Deltamethrine. IRS in affected locality in human dwellings and cattle dwellings. Day to day monitoring of anti-larval and anti Tick measures done. Active surveillance of contact cases is being done. (Based on revised report from SSO)

Cases of fever reported from Madina Nagar, PHC Singasandra, Bangalore Urban. RRT investigated the outbreak. 2 water samples were collected & sent to PHI were found not potable. House to house active search for cases done. Temporary clinic opened and patients treated on spot. Aedes larva survey initiated. Health education done. Public advised to consume boiled and cooled water.

Outbreak of fever reported from Village/SC Jamanapur, CHC/Block Khalwa, District Khandwa. Male and female were equally affected. RRT visited the affected area. Cases treated locally. Stagnant water and poor sanitary condition around houses in the affected area. Out of 27 cases tested by RDK for malaria, 1 case found positive for P. falciparum. 27 blood slides collected, result awaited. Villagers advised on personal protection and environmental sanitation.

Cases of fever reported from Mira Bhayinder Corporation, Navghar Nagari, Mangalnagar. Entomological survey was conducted in the affected area: HI-0.68, CI-0.41,BI-0.68. Blood slides of fever cases were tested for malaria and all were negative. 3 blood serum samples were collected & sent to Civil Hospital Thane for dengue testing. Daily surveillance of fever cases and entomological surveillance conducted under the supervision of MOH, Mira-Bhayinder Corporation.

Cases of fever reported from Village South puliankulam, SC Kadamboduvalvu, PHC Eruvadi, Block Kalakadu, District Tirunelveli. RRT investigated the outbreak. 10 blood slides were examined at PHC for malarial parasite, all were found negative. 5 serum samples were collected & sent to Tirunelveli Medical College, result awaited. Anti-Larval work, source reduction and fogging done. All cases treated.

Cases of fever reported from Kalyan Dombiwalli (KDMC) Corporation, Dr. Ambedkar Road UHP, Kalathalav Ward, Rajyog Society (Urban). Entomological survey was conducted in the affected area: HI-9.52, CI- 9.52, BI-4.08. All fever blood samples were tested for malaria and were found negative. 2 blood serum samples sent to Sentinel Surveillance lab, Civil Hospital Thane for dengue testing, result awaited. Daily surveillance of fever cases and surveillance of vector is being conducted under the supervision of MOH, KDMC.

Cases of fever reported from Village Doddakamaballi, SC Neelagirihalliunder, PHC Andersonpoint, Block Bangarpet, District Kolar. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Symptomatic treatment given to cases. Source reduction activities done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Bhalsawa, PHC Jawar, Block & District Khandwa. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Stagnant rain water & poor sanitary conditions were observed in the affected area. All cases treated. 30 blood slides collected which tested negative for malaria. Health education given regarding personal hygiene, safe drinking water & sanitation.

Cases of fever reported from Village Patha, SC Kreshar Tapariya, Amola Colony 2-3-4, CHC Karera, District Shivpuri. District RRT and Block health team investigated the outbreak. Active search for fever cases done. Health camp organized. Cases treated. 73 blood slides collected which tested negative for malaria. Anti-larval activities done.

Outbreak of fever reported from Village Bindakheda, PHC Ghatoli, Block Bakani, District Jhalawar. Block RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Medical camp organized in the affectd area. All 42 blood smears collected were negative for malaria parasite. All cases treated locally. Disinfection of the surrounding done. Pyrethrum spray done in the affected area. Anti larval measures undertaken. Health education done.

Outbreak of fever reported from Village/SC Ezhusempon, PHC Anniyur, Block Kedar, District Villupuram. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Out of 6 serum samples collected 5 were positive for Widal. Pipe lines rectified. Chlorination of water sources done.

Cases of fever reported from Panchvati, Goraksh Nagar, Dindori Road, Nasik corporation, District Nasik. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. All 15 blood smears collected were negative for malaria. Serum samples collected; result awaited. Fogging done in the affected area. Health education given regarding personal protection.

Cases of fever reported from Waliv, Golani campus of Vasai-Virar Municipal Corporation, District Thane. Medical team investigated the outbreak. One case was positive for Dengue by rapid diagnostic kit. Active search of fever cases done. 4 serum samples collected and sent to Civil Hospital Lab, Thane; result awaited.

Outbreak reported from Village/SC DaktiDahanu, PHC Chinchani, Block Dahanu, District Thane. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Cases presented with high grade fever with breathlessness, body pain, giddiness. All cases treated locally. All 5 serum samples were negative for Leptospirosis (IgM ELISA). 5 serum samples collected and sent to Civil Hospital for Dengue; result awaited. Health education done by distributing leaflets regarding vector control measures.

Cases of fever reported from Village/SC Maddirala, PHC Nuthankal, District Nalagonda. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for fever cases done. Cases treated locally. All 42 blood smears collected, tested negative for malaria. Anti- larval activities using Temephos done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Sukaliya CHC Killod, Block Killod, District Khandwa. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All cases treated locally. All 25 blood smears were negative for malaria. Antilarval activities undertaken. Health education regarding vector control measures given.

Cases of fever reported from Village/SC Kosbi, PHC Vadadha, Block Armori, District Gadhchiroli. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. entomological survey done. 14 blood smears collected were negative for malaria. 11 serum samples collected; result awaited. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from Village & SC Ambadi, PHC Vrajeshwari, Block Bhiwandi, District Thane. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All cases treated locally. Entomological survey revealed Adult density of Anopheles=5.7, Culex=15.2 and Aedes =11.7. Aedes entomological indices were HI=18.75, CI=12.38 and BI =27.08. Storage of water was observed in the community. 29 blood smears collected wer negative for malaria. 7 serum samples collected;result awaited. Antilarval activities and fogging done in the community.

Cases of fever reported from Village Patrahi, Block & CHC Rampura, District Jalaun. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search of fever cases done. Health camp was organized. 10 blood smears were collected; result awaited. Health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village Dhorgatta, SC Pendhari, PHC Pendhari, Block Dhanora, District Ghadchiroli. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. All cases treated. 15 blood smears collected; result awaited. Entomological survey done. IEC done regarding vector control measure.

Cases of fever reported from Village/SC Javalgaon, PHC Haimayatnagar District Nanded. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Community had the practice of storing water in cement tanks. Entomological survey revealed high indices. 3 serum samples collected; result awaited. Blood smears collected were negative for malaria. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Sukhpur, PHC Kodki, Block Bhuj, District Kutch. District RRT investigated the outbreak. A 28 year male was admitted in a private hospital in Bhuj on 02/08/13 with complaints of fever, headache and abdominal pain. Patient was referred to a private hospital in Ahmedabad on 04/08/13 for further treatment. He expired on 06/08/13. Patient’s serum sample tested positive for CCHF by Real Time RT-PCR in NIV, Pune. 5 more serum samples taken and sent to NIV, Pune tested negative for CCHF by Real Time RT-PCR. Entomological survey done. 20 cattle serum samples and 10 tick samples sent to NIV, Pune; result awaited. Control measures undertaken. Contacts have been kept under surveillance. Garbage removal and cleanliness drive undertaken in the village by Gram Panchayat. Anti-larval activities, fogging and insecticide spray done. Acarecidal treatment of cattle with Deltamethrin undertaken by Veterinary Department. Search for more cases continues.

Case reported from Village Bidada, PHC Talwana, Block Mandvi, District Kutch. District RRT investigated the outbreak. A 48 year male admitted in a private hospital in Bhuj on 09/08/13 with complaints of fever, headache, diarrhoea. Patient was transferred to Rajkot on 11/08/13 for further treatment. Patient died on 13/08/13. Patient’s serum sample sent to NIV, Pune tested positive for CCHF by Real Time RT-PCR. Entomological survey done. 30 cattle serum samples sent to NIV, Pune; result awaited. Control measures undertaken. Contacts have been kept under surveillance. Garbage removal and cleanliness drive undertaken in the village by Gram Panchayat. Anti-larval activities, fogging and insecticide spray done. Acarecidal treatment of cattle with Deltamethrin undertaken by Veterinary Department. Search for more cases continues.

Cases reported from Village Kadirenahalli, PHC Budikote, Block Bangarpet, District Kolar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Cases treated. 1 blood sample collected; result awaited. Anti-larval activities done. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Wadegaon, SC Gadegaon, PHC Rajura Bazaar, Block Warud, District Amravati. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Active search for fever cases done. Csaes treated. All 12 blood slides collected tested negative for malaria. 7 serum samples collected; result awaited. Anti- larval activities done. IEC done.

Case reported from Village Dharmasala, PHC Dhandhalpur, Block Sayala, District Surendranagar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Population of the affected area was 1787. A 55 year old male with complaints of high grade fever, headache and gastritis admitted in PDU, Medical College Hospital, Rajkot on 27/07/13 and expired on 31/07/13. Patient tested positive for CCHF by Real Time RT-PCR in NIV, Pune. 8 more serum samples were collected and sent to NIV, Pune, which tested negative for CCHF by Real Time RT-PCR. Entomological survey done. 14 cattle serum samples and 4 pools of ticks sent to NIV, Pune which tested negative for CCHFV. Control measures undertaken. Monitoring of contacts of the confirmed case is being undertaken. Garbage removal and cleanliness drive undertaken in the village by Gram Panchayat. Anti-larval activities, fogging and insecticide spray done. Acarecidal treatment of cattle with Deltamethrin undertaken by Veterinary Department. Search for more cases continues.

Cases reported from Village Undara, PHC Sampra, District Patan. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Population of the affected area was 4343. A 68 year female admitted in a private hospital in Patan on 11/07/13 with complaints of fever, headache and abdominal pain. Patient was referred to BJMC, Ahmedabad on 18/07/13 for further treatment. She died on 20/07/13. Another patient (7 year male) developed fever, nausea, vomiting and headache on 16/07/13 and admitted in Dharpur Medical College, Patan. Patient recovered. Both cases tested positive for CCHF in NIV, Pune by Real Time RT-PCR. 8 more serum samples were collected and sent to NIV, Pune, which tested negative for CCHF by Real Time RT- PCR. Entomological survey done. 35 cattle serum samples and 67 pools of ticks sent to NIV, Pune which tested negative for CCHFV. Control measures undertaken. Contacts under surveillance. Garbage removal and cleanliness drive undertaken in the village by Gram Panchayat. Anti-larval activities, fogging and insecticide spray done. Acarecidal treatment of cattle with Deltamethrin undertaken by Veterinary Department. Search for more cases continues.

Cases of fever reported from Village Bodatola, SC Ghogari, PHC Rasmohini, Block Burhar, District Shahdol. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Cases treated symptomatically. Out of 70 blood slides collected, 1slide was positive for malaria.

A fever outbreak (29 cases) was reported in the previous week (ending on 4th August 2013) from Village/SC Ambadi, PHC Vajreshwari, Block Bhiwandi, District Thane. Further, 10 cases and 1 death occurred till 11/08/13. 7 serum samples collected and sent to Civil Hospital Thane; result awaited.

Cases of fever reported from Village Mamidivalasa, District Srikakulam. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Poor sanitary conditions were observed in the locality. Cases treated symptomatically. All 34 blood smears examined tested negative for malaria. IEC done.

Case reported from Village Bhuvava, Block Savarkundla, District Amreli. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Population of the affected area was 1800. A 50 year male admitted in PDU, Medical College, Rajkot on 11/08/13 with complaints of fever, giddiness and gastritis. Patient recovered. Serum sample sent to NIV, Pune tested positive for CCHF by Real Time RT-PCR. Entomological survey done. Out of 50 cattle serum samples sent to NIV, Pune, 10 samples tested positive for CCHFV. 5 pools of ticks sent to NIV, Pune, 1 pool positive for CCHFV from house of CCHF confirm case. Control measures undertaken. Contacts have been kept under surveillance. Garbage removal and cleanliness drive undertaken in the village by Gram Panchayat. Anti-larval activities, fogging and insecticide spray done. Acarecidal treatment of cattle with Deltamethrin undertaken by Veterinary Department. Search for more cases continues.

Cases of fever reported from Village Dhangaon, Block Chaigaonmakhan, District Khandwa. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All cases treated symptomatically. Anti larval activities done in the affected area. Health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village Khairi, SC Belgaon, PHC Deulgaon, Block Kurkheda, District Gadchiroli. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 32 blood smears collected were tested negative for malaria. 19 serum samples collected and sent to IGMC Nagpur; result awaited. Fogging done. Vector control measures undertaken. Health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village Chakalpeth, SC Navegaon Mal, PHC Amgaon, Block Chamorshi, District Gadchiroli. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 19 blood smears collected were negative for malaria. 9 serum samples collected; result awaited. Health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village Madanthai, SC M.Nedunkulam, PHC Pambur, Block Paramakudi, District Ramanathpuram. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. 8 blood smears and 14 blood serum samples collected; result awaited. Antilarval activity done. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Navegaon, SC Mulkhala, PHC Porla, Block Gadchiroli, District Ghadchiroli. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 2 serum samples collected; result awaited. Entomological survey done. Fogging done. Vector control measures undertaken. Health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village/SC Masalga, PHC Panchincholi, Block Nilanga, District Latur. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Active search of cases done. Cases treated symptomatically. 15 blood smears collected tested negative for malaria. 4 serum samples collected; result awaited. Entomological survey done. Fogging and antilarval activities undertaken. Halth education done.

Cases of fever reported from Village/SC/PHC Vairagad, Block Armori, District Gadchiroli. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Cases treated at local health centre. All 35 blood smears examined tested negative for malaria. 2 serum samples collected; result awaited. Anti- larval activities done.

Cases of fever reported from Village/SC Samrod, PHC Wakadi, Block Jamner, District Jalgaon. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for fever cases done. Cases treated symptomatically. 22 blood smears collected tested negative for malaria. Health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village/PHC Sheghat, Block Warud, District Amravati. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Cases treated. All 25 blood smears collected tested negative for malaria. 6 serum samples collected; result awaited. Anti-larval activities done. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Dhanwani, Block /District Khandwa. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search of fever cases done. 29 blood smears collected; result awaited. All cases treated. Pyrethrum spray done in the affected area. Health education given regarding personal protection.

Cases of fever reported from Village Baldua Dongari, PHC Jawar, Block Killod, District Khandwa. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Entomological survey done. All cases treated symptomatically. Pyrethrum spray done. Health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village Manimpur, SC Pala, PHC Hiwarkhed, Block Morshi, District Amravati. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Cases treated. All 35 blood smears collected tested negative for malaria. Anti-larval activities done. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Bori Mahal, SC Bori Mahal, PHC Nanza, Block Kalamb, District Yavatmal. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. 7 serum samples collected; result awaited. Antilarval activities done.

Disease/ Illness: xlvii Crimean - Congo Haemorr hagic fever (CCHF)
Comments/ Action Taken: Case reported from Village Lathi, District Amreli. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Population of the affected area was 20886. A 45 year female admitted in PDU, Medical College, Rajkot on 15/08/13 with complaints of fever and gastritis. Patient expired on 18/08/13. Serum sample sent to NIV, Pune tested positive for CCHF by Real Time RT-PCR. A total of 20 cattle serum samples and 40 pool of hard ticks sample have been collected and sent to NIV, Pune; result awaited. Garbage removal and cleanliness drive undertaken in the village by Gram Panchayat. Antilarval activity, fogging and insecticide spray. Veterinary Dept has undertaken Acarecidal treatment on cattle with Deltametrhrin. Search for cases is being done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Inderkoot, Block Sumbai, District Bandipora. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Open defecation was rampant in the community. 8 blood samples collected were positive for widal. Water samples collected; result awaited. Health education regarding proper sanitation and safe drinking water imparted.

Cases of fever with joint pain reported from Village Kamanpura, PHC Amayan, Block Mehgaon, District Bhind. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. 9 serum samples collected; result awaited. Source reduction activity using temephos done. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Kawathi, SC Chekthanewasana, PHC Navegaonmore, Block Pombhurna, District Chandrapur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases treated at GH Chandrapur. Serum samples collected; result awaited. Control measures undertaken.
Cases reported from Village Petgaon, PHC Chichpali, Block/District Chandrapur. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Cases treated locally. Health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village/SC Chichambhar, PHC Mop, Block Risod, District Washim. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Temporary medical camp organized. Cases treated. All 53 blood smears examined tested negative for malaria. 5 serum samples collected and sent to GMC, Akola; result awaited. Anti-larval activities using Temiphos and fogging done. IEC done.

13 suspected cases and 5 deaths due to CCHF were reported from Village Kariyana, Taluka Babra, District Amreli in 28th week (ending on 14th July 2013). Now the State has revised the case definition and lab confirmed case had been considered as case of CCHF. Henceforth, the State has reduced CCHF cases to 10 cases and 2 deaths.

Cases of fever reported from Zadibal and Shoperibagh urban area of Srinagar, District Srinagar. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Symptomatic treatment given to cases. 4 blood samples collected; result awaited. 3 water samples collected; result awaited. Chlorine tablets distributed. Health education imparted regarding use of boiled water for drinking purposes and personal hygiene.

Cases of fever reported from SC Takerkheda, PHC Aasti, Block Bhatkuli, District Amravati. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Symptomatic treatment given to cases. 69 blood slides collected were negative for malaria. 6 serum samples collected; result awaited. Antilarval activity and fogging done. Health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village & SC Wakadi, PHC Anwa, Block Bhokardan, District Jalna. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 25 blood smears collected were negative for malaria. 7 serum samples collected; result awaited. Antilarval activities and fogging done. Health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village & SC Paradh, PHC Walsawangi, Block Bhokardan, District Jalna. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search of fever cases done. All 55 blood smears collected were negative for Malaria. 15 serum samples collected; result awaited. Symptomatic treatment given to cases. Vector control measures such as antilaral activities and fogging undertaken. Health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village Krushnanagar, SC Dubere, PHC Thangaon, District Nashik. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Entomological survey revealed CI=1.29, HI=3.42 and BI=3.42. Cases treated symptomatically. 12 serum samples collected; result awaited. All 13 blood smears collected were negative for Malaria. Dry day observed in the community. Anti-larval activities and fogging done. IEC done regarding personal protective measures and environmental sanitation.

Cases of fever and body ache reported from Village Jamukheda, PHC Bhainsdehi, District Betul. Block health team investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 22 blood smears collected were negative for malaria.

Cases of fever with myalgia reported from Village Annur, SC Mudachinthnahalli, PHC Kurbur, District Chikkaballapur. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Cases treated at local health centre. 2 serum samples collected; result awaited. Anti-larval activities and fogging done. IEC done.

Case reported from Shanti Nagar, Sarpat Gate, Bhuj (urban) in District Kutch. A 48 year old female patient complained of high grade fever with vomiting and chest pain visited GK General Hospital on 08-09-2013. She was admitted first to a private hospital (Yash Hospital) in Bhuj on 08-09-2013 and later referred to GK General Hospital, Bhuj on 10-09-2013 after her condition deteriorated and she became unconscious. Her condition worsened further and she developed cough, runny nose, diarrhea, haemoptysis and haematuria. The patient died on 13-09-2013 because of cardio respiratory failure due to Viral Haemorrhagic Fever. The serum sample of patient sent to NIV Pune tested positive for Crimean Congo Hemorrhagic Fever (CCHF). House to house survey has been done by District RRT in the affected areas. All contacts of the case are kept under surveillance. One person, who came in close contact with the CCHF patient, was admitted in GK General Hospital with mild fever and his serum sample has been sent to PDMU Rajkot and NIV Pune; result awaited. No new case has been reported in the area. Animal husbandry department has been informed regarding preventive measures.

Cases of fever with body ache reported from Village Radhanagar, CHC/Block Chas, District Bokaro. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases treated symptomatically. 5 serum samples collected; result awaited. Anti-larval activities and fogging done. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from Village & S/C Bodadha, PHC Koregaon, Block Wadasa, District Gadhchiroli. House to house fever survey done. Cases treated symptomatically. 10 blood smears collected tested negative for malaria. Further, 20 blood smears collected; result awaited. Control measures undertaken.

Cases of fever reported from Village & S/C Bodwad, PHC Endgaon, Block Bodwad, District Jalgaon. District RRT investigated the outbreak. People practiced water storage due to water scarcity. 14 blood smears collected tested negative for malaria. 10 serum samples collected and sent to GMC Aurangabad; result awaited. Dry day observed in the community. Anti-larval activities done. IEC activities undertaken.

Cases of fever reported from Village Khokartale, PHC Kumbhale, Block Peth, District Nashik. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Cases treated symptomatically. Out of 19 blood smears examined, 2 smears were positive for P. falciparum. Anti-larval activities done. IEC done regarding personal protection.

Cases of fever reported from Village Haidalpura, CHC Madhogarh, District Jalaun. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. 38 blood smears collected; result awaited. Cases treated locally. Health education given.

Cases of fever with joint pain reported from Villages Mallanayakanahalli and Puttenahalli, PHC Mallanyakanahalli, Block Mulbagal, District Kolar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for fever cases done. Cases treated locally. 2 serum samples collected were positive for Chikungunya (IgM ELISA). Entomological survey done. Anti-larval activities and fogging done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Sawangi, S/C & PHC Pusala, Block Warud, District Amravati. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for fever cases done. Cases treated locally. All 21 blood smears examined tested negative for malaria. Anti-larval activities done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Zunuthula, SC Thandarpally, PHC/ Block Gurrampode, District Nalgonda. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done. Temporary medical camps organized. Cases treated. All 19 blood smears collected, were negative for Malaria. Anti larval activities and fogging done. Health education regarding personal protective measures given.

Cases of fever reported from Village Beerelligudem, SC Pulipalpula, PHC & Block Munugode, District Nalgonda. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. One death occurred in 35yr old male. Temporary medical camps organized. Cases treated symptomatically. All 23 blood smears collected were negative for Malaria. Anti larval activities done. Health education given.

Cases of fever headache and joint pain reported from Village Karli, SC Jamati, PHC Murtizapur, District Akola. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done. Cases treated symptomatically. 3 serum samples collected; result awaited. Anti-larval activities and fogging done. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from Village/ SC and PHC Kenwad, Block Risod, District Washim. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All cases treated. 3 serum samples collected; result awaited. Antilarval activity done. Health education given.

Cases of fever with sore throat reported from Village Thalwalgaon, Block Jaunpur, District Tehri Garhwal. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. One death occurred in a 9yr old female child. Poor hygiene and sanitation was observed in the community. Medical camps organized. All cases treated locally. All 10 blood smears collected were negative for malaria. 4 blood samples collected and sent to VCSG Medical College; result awaited. IEC done.

Cases of fever with body ache reported from Village Samba, SC Vijaypur, PHC Purmandal, Distrcit Samba. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done. All cases treated locally. Serum samples collected; result awaited. Anti larval activities and fogging done. Health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village Katheel Dangu, PHC/Block Majalta, District Udhampur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Temporary medical camp organized. Cases treated. Out of 76 blood samples collected, 28 samples were positive for Widal test. Chlorine tablets distributed in the community. Health education given regarding use of boiled water for drinking purposes and sanitation.

Cases of fever reported from Village/SC Jarud, PHC Rajura Bazaar, Block Warud, District Amravati. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. All cases treated. All 58 blood smears collected were negative for Malaria. 3 serum samples collected; result awaited. Entomological survey done. Dry day observed in the community. Cases reported from Village/SC Ramdhari, PHC Songadh, Block Sihor, District Bhavnagar. Cases reported from Sector-19, District Panchkula. Cases presented with loose stools and vomiting. 44 blood samples were collected. Out of which, 13 samples were found positive for Typhoid by Widal test. District RRT investigated the case. It was found that drinking water supply was contaminated with sandy water. Symptomatic treatment was given to all the cases. Chlorine tablets were distributed. Health education was given regarding importance of safe drinking water.

Cases reported from Village Ramdhari, PHC Songadh, District Bhavnagar. Four animal blood samples and ten tick samples were collected and sent to NIV Pune. Tick samples were tested for Crimean- Congo hemorrhagic fever Virus by RT PCR and livestock samples were tested by anti- CCHF Cattle IgG ELISA assay. All of the animal samples tested negative and one of the tick samples tested positive for the CCHF virus. The deceased was a female aged 55 years. District RRT investigated the outbreak and implemented anti-tick measures, spraying of insecticide over animals and households were done. All cases were treated symptomatically and health education was given on the importance of vector control measures.

DDT spray and house to house survey is done.

Cases reported from Village- Nari, CHC - Kisko, Block - Kisko with fever and bodyache. Total 45 serum samples were collected and tested for Dengue IgM ELISA. Two found positive at Microbiology department, RIMS,Ranchi. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done, IEC done & Anti larval activities has been done. DDT spray and house to house survey is done.

Patient residing in the Panchvada Village complained of fever, joint pain for three days. Patient took symptomatic treatment for a week, where he was investigated and report showed depleted platelet count, hence patient got admitted at Sir T General Hospital, Bhavnagar. He was treated as CCHF Suspected case and the report came positive for CCHF on 01/10/22. District RRT investigated the outbreak, following which active surveillance using the working case definition of CCHF was started in the village. Temperature monitoring (twice a day) of all contacts implemented. Anti-tick Measures were taken by Health department & Animal Husbandry department which included Insecticide spraying (Deltamethrin) over animals, households, Deltaforce liquid for washing animals and treatment for animals was given. Indoor Malathion+ Lime Powder Dusting was done in 40 houses and total 03 streets of village & total 08 Gaman covered during dusting. OPD services were started in the village for screening of suspected cases.

Case reported from Paladi Road Area, Shivendranagar Village, Taluk Gariyadhar, Dist Bhavnagar, with symptoms of fever, headache and epistaxis, in a shepherd (cattle work) who has 16 Domestic Animals in House. Due to persistent symptoms, patient was referred to tertiary care BIMS Hospital, Bhavnagar where physician diagnosed patient as Viral hemorrhagic disease and referred him to Government Hospital at Sir T General Hospital, Bhavnagar on 19/10/22 where he was reported positive for CCHF on 22/10/2022. District & Taluka Rapid Response Team visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. Active Surveillance using the Working case definition of CCHF started in the village and a total of 11 close contacts and 18 Health care contacts were identified. Anti Tick Measures taken by Health department & Animal Husbandry department which include Insecticide spraying (Deltamethrin) over animals, households, Deltaforce liquid for washing animals and treatment for animals given. Indoor Melathion+Lime Powder Dusting done in 20 houses and total 02 streets of village & total 06 Gaman covered during dusting.

Cases reported from Village- K.M Doddi A, PHC/CHC- K.M Doddi, CHC- Taluk Maddur, District- Mandya with fever. Five blood, Fifteen RAT Samples and Thirty six samples collected and sent to DSL Mandya, where all five Blood Sample collected for Dengue & Chikungunya tested negative, 15 tested for RAT came Covid negative and 36 Blood Smear Collected were negative. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.

Cases reported with fever with thrombocytopenia, headache, giddiness from village- Enjar, SC- Naduvapatti, PHC- Krishnaperi of district Virudhunagar. Eight blood samples taken, where three tested IgM Dengue Positive and one tested positive for typhoid by Widal test. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given. House to House Fever surveillance conducted. Source reduction done. 427 Houses were covered with Antilarval work. Indoor and Outdoor thermal fogging done. Pipeline leakages was detected and the local body was instructed to rectify that immediately. OHT cleaned and chlorination done in the affected village.

Cases reported from Vaishali Nagar, in Latur Block area, Sub center Babhalgaon, PHC Bori with fever less than 7 days. Nine blood serum sample tested for Chikungunya at Sentinel Testing Lab, Nanded from which eight people were found Chikungunya Positive by IgM ELISA. Blood serum for malaria sample of 10 people tested by DMO office Latur were all found negative by peripheral smear. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given. All necessary actions like fever survey, Container survey, fogging, abetting, IEC, sanitation survey were undertaken as per state guidelines.

Cases reported from Village S Devaganahalli, PHC/CHC Sadli, Taluk Sidlaghatta, District Chikkaballapura. Thirteen and Two blood samples collected and sent to DPHL Chikkaballapura, which tested negative for Dengue IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given regarding use of mosquito repellants & use of safe drinking water. Fever & larva survey was done by health workers. Health check-up was done to all school children by the Sadli PHC Medical officer. Adviced for source reduction & larvae surveillance activities. Instructed to Gram Panchayath to take up fogging activity & maintain sanitation of the village.

Cases reported from Village S Devaganahalli, PHC/CHC Sadli, Taluk Sidlaghatta, District Chikkaballapura. Thirteen and Two blood samples collected and sent to DPHL Chikkaballapura, which tested negative for Dengue IgM ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given regarding use of mosquito repellants & use of safe drinking water. Fever & larva survey was done by health workers. Health check-up was done to all school children by the Sadli PHC Medical officer. Adviced for source reduction & larvae surveillance activities. Instructed to Gram Panchayath to take up fogging activity & maintain sanitation of the village.

Cases reported from Block Katambazhiopuram, PHC Cherplassery, probably due to consumption of contaminated water supplied through pipeline. Cases clinically diagnosed as Enteric fever. Two water samples collected and sent to PH Lab Kozhikode; result awaited. District RRT visited the affected area and necessary instructions were given regarding proper chlorination and disinfection of water sources. IEC activities undertaken.
Cases reported from Village Punchadih, PHC Ladhurka, Block Hura, Area Punchadih. Sera specimens collected for lab test; result is pending. Vitamin –A given to all patients.

Cases of high fever clinically diagnosed as Typhoid, reported from Bazpur, Jaspur. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. All cases treated. Severe cases referred to nearby hospital for treatment. Blood sample collected for lab analysis; result awaited. Chlorination of water sources done. IEC activities undertaken regarding sanitation and hygienic practices.

Outbreak reported from Village Dhalpur PHC/Block Dhalpur. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. Active search carried out by ANM and ASHA. Water samples from drinking water sources tested with H2S strip for fecal contamination at PHC; found contaminated. IEC activities undertaken regarding safe drinking water and hygienic practices.

Outbreak reported from neighboring villages (Bengenagorah, Chowkham, Biolotia, Bedlong , Jukota, Kurimari, Kathgaon & Pathlial) under PHC Bengenagorah, PHC Machkhowa and PHC Sissimukh. Sera samples of all cases were Widal positive at Bengenagorah CHC. Blood samples sent for culture; result awaited. PHC medical officer with team visited the affected area and organized a medical camp. Water samples collected for examination by H2S kit found contaminated. IEC activities undertaken.

Outbreak of fever reported from Shiyal Para, Sub Center Kumarganj. District RRT visited and investigated the affected area. Blood samples sent for lab investigation; result awaited. Health education given regarding hygienic practices and sanitation measures and personal protection measures. All cases treated symptomatically.

Cases reported from Manjimajra and surrounding Villages of UT. 12 positive cases have been detected in Manimajra and the surrounding villages by Widal test. Chief Engineer and Medical Officer Health of Municipal Corporation, Chandigarh have been informed about the current situation and are requested to take further necessary actions to stop the increase cases. IEC activities undertaken regarding safe drinking water, hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Cases reported from Manjimajra and surrounding Villages of UT. 23 positive cases have been detected in Manimajra and the surrounding villages by Widal test. Chief Engineer and Medical Officer Health of Municipal Corporation of Chandigarh have been informed about the current situation and are requested to take further necessary actions to stop the increase cases. IEC activities undertaken regarding safe drinking water and hygienic practices.

Cases with fever reported from Phonata, PHC Etro. District RRT visited and investigated the affected areas. Out of 35 blood samples collected, malaria tested negative for all, 17 samples tested positive for Widal test. Other lab investigtations being done at JNIMS. Water samples from drinking water source sent for lab testing; result awaited. IEC activities undertaken regarding safe drinking water, hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Cases of fever occurred in Malavalli Town under Malavalli Taluk probably due to contamination of drinking water caused by mixing with sewage water. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. Blood samples collected for lab confirmation; two cases tested positive for Typhoid by Widal test. Disinfection of water sources done. IEC activities undertaken regarding safe drinking water, hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Cases reported from Alawalpur (Bhagwanpur). The outbreak occurred due to consumption of contaminated water. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Shallow hand pumps are the only source for drinking water. Majority of the population use open fields for defecation. There is no permanent water disposal system for waste water. On lab investigation three cases found widal test positive. Water sample collected for the investigation of fecal contamination. Results are awaited. IEC-Pamphlets were distributed and treatment given to all.

Outbreak reported from Chittarikkal Athirumavu ST Colony (PHC Chittarikkal). Age group of affected people 18-46 years, All cases had symptoms of fever and were admitted in Pvt. Hospitals. There is no water source in the colony and people depend on near by water stream for drinking and bathing. Outbreak investigation conducted by M.O. Medical camp conducted on 06/10/10. Sample tested in Labs attached to Pvt. Hospitals showed Widal positive. Chlorination of the water sources, health education conducted, House to house visit conducted for further Fever cases.

Cases reported from Manjimajra and surrounding Villages of UT. 19 positive cases have been detected in Manimajra and the surrounding villages by Widal test. Chief Engineer and Medical Officer Health of Municipal Corporation, Chandigarh have been informed about the current situation and are requested to take further necessary actions to stop the increase cases. IEC activities undertaken regarding safe drinking water, hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Outbreak reported from (Nadia/Kalyani SD/Chakdaha Block/ Kanchrapara GP/Vill- Charbirpara). Block RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. Health education and symptomatic treatment to those affected given.

Outbreak reported from Ubidpur Vill under Khanakul-I GP (73 cases) and Abadpara vill/Berala Konchmali GP (50 cases). Block & SD RRT visited and investigated the affected area. 56 Blood samples collected & sent to STM, Kolkata for lab investigation; result awaited. Medical camp setup at the affected area to treat cases. Active house to house survey done by health staff for fever cases. IEC and health education activities undertaken regarding hygienic practices.

Outbreak of fever and joint pain clinically diagnosed as Chikungunya reported from Sindrani, Harinagar, Boardhar, Karamari, Jhitkipota, Pathuria, Magurkona, Pustighata Sarahati, Khutibari, Ghonarmath, Kharermath, Akandatala, Raghabpur, Natunpara, Kamalabash, Charmandal, Bagula, Naldugari, Parmadan under Bagdah Block. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. 8 sera samples sent to School of Tropical Medicine, Kolkata; result awaited. Active house-to-house survey done by health staff. IEC activities undertaken regarding early treatment of cases and personal protection measures to be adopted by the community.

Cases reported from Manjimajra and surrounding Villages of UT, Chandigarh. 17 cases positive by Widal test have been reported from Manimajra and the surrounding villages. Chief Engineer and Medical Officer Health of Municipal Corporation, Chandigarh informed about the current situation and requested to take further necessary actions. IEC activities undertaken regarding safe drinking water, hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Outbreak reported from Vill Natunkalipur & Suvash Nagar, GP Bathjangla, SD Nadia Sadar, Block Krishnagar-I. Block level medical team visited the affected area. All cases treated symptomatically. Severely ill patients hospitalized at Kanla SGH. 5 serum samples collected and sent to NICED, Kolkata for Chikungunya and Dengue test; lab result awaited. Health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Cases of fever reported from Village Musarne, SC Chinchghar, PHC investigated the Kudus, Block Wada, District Thane. District RRT outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Cases treated at local health centre. Serum samples collected; result awaited. Anti-larval activities and fogging done. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Aaware, SC Kambare, PHC Aghai, Block Shahpur, District Thane. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. 7 serum samples collected; result awaited. All blood smears collected were negative for malaria. Entomological survey done. Vector control measures undertaken.

Cases of fever reported from Village Jayparakashnagar SC Nanded PHC Khadakwasla Block Haveli, District Pune. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Cases treated locally. Serum samples collected; result awaited. Entomological survey done. Anti larval activities and fogging done. Health education given regarding personal protection.

Cases of fever reported from urban area (Ward no 1, 4 & 5), Jorhat Urban, District Jorhat. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done. Temporary medical camps organized. All cases treated symptomatically. 13 samples collected were positive for S.typhi culture. 42 water samples collected were not potable. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Hindaskatte, PHC/CHC Yalladakere, Block Hiriyur, District Chitradurga. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Cases treated at local health centre. 10 serum samples collected; result awaited. 2 water samples collected were not potable. Control measures undertaken. IEC done.

Cases of fever, headache and joint pain reported from Village /SC Sirsoli, PHC Adgaon, Block Telhara, District Akola. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Cases treated locally. 5 serum samples collected; result awaited. Entomological survey done. Anti-larval activities and fogging done in the affected area. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from an urban industrial unit in Block Shrigondha, District Ahmednagar. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done. Cases treated locally. 4 serum samples; result awaited. Entomological survey done. Anti-larval activities and fogging done in the affected area. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Chikka Kolachi, PHC Hire Hadagali, Block Hadagali, District Bellary. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 26 blood smears collected were negative for malaria. 6 serum samples collected; result awaited. Vector control measure undertaken.

Cases of fever reported from PHC’s Rajgurunagar, Khadus, Block Khed, District Pune. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 241 cases and 1 death occurred in PHC Rajgurunagar and 38 cases occurred in PHC Khadus. Open defecation was observed in the community. Out of 41 water samples collected, 20 samples were not potable. Out of 12 blood samples collected and sent to State Public Health Lab, Pune; 5 samples were positive for S.typhi by culture. Health camp organized in the village. Symptomatic treatment given to cases. Alternate drinking water sources provided. Chlorination of water sources done. Health education regarding safe drinking water, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases of fever with joint pain reported from Village Shillongia Basti, SC Amsing Jorabat, Block Sonapur, District Kamrup (M). District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done. All cases were animal handlers. 15 blood smears were negative for malaria. All cases treated locally. Health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village Sarchi & Jamala, SC Sarchi, Block Banjar, District Kullu. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All the cases were provided with presumptive treatment. Out of 06 blood samples sent for blood culture, 1 sample tested positive for Enteric fever. House to house survey done to identify more cases. IEC done.

Cases of fever with chills reported from Village/SC/PHC Mhasa Gaon, Block Murbad, District Thane. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Blood smears collected were negative for malaria. Entomological survey done. All cases treated symptomatically. Vector control measures undertaken. Health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Cases of fever, rash, cough & coryza reported from Village Tankotola, SC Hathya, Block Chakradharpur, District West Singhbhum. District RRT and Block health team investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Symptomatic treatment given to cases. Affected children were less than 15 years of age. 5 serum samples collected for Measles and Rubella. All the 5 serum samples tested negative for Measles (IgM ELISA). Serum samples collected for Rubella; result awaited

Cases of fever reported from Mini Gurukul School in Village Yelmapally, SC Machavaram, PHC Mannanoor, Block Amrabad, District Mahboobnagar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done. All cases treated symptomatically. Out of 7 blood samples collected, 5 samples were positive for S.typhi by culture. 4 water samples collected and sent to water quality monitoring lab; result awaited. Health education given regarding personal hygiene and sanitation.

Disease/ Illness: iv. Crimean Congo Haemorrhag ic Fever (CCHF)
Comments/ Action Taken: Case reported from Village/SC/PHC Shekhdi, Block Petlad, District Anand. A 50 year female admitted in a private hospital in Anand on 12/03/14 with complaints of fever with vomiting, chest pain and bleeding gums. Patient died on 13/03/13. Patient’s serum sample sent to NIV, Pune tested positive for CCHF by RT-PCR. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Contacts have been kept under surveillance. Anti-tick control measures undertaken by Animal Husbandry Department. Garbage removal and cleanliness drive undertaken in the village by Gram Panchayat. IEC done. No new case reported.

Cases of fever reported from Village Chickkachelluru, PHC/CHC Doddac Halluru, Block Challakere, District Chitradurga. District RRT investigated the outbreak House to house survey done. Pipeline leakages were observed in the community. 10 serum samples collected and sent to DPL, Chitradurga for Dengue, Chikungunya & Leptospirosis; result awaited. Entomological survey done. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Ramasagar, SC Pakruthi, PHC/CHC Ashok Siddapura, Block, Molakalmuru, District Chitradurga. District RRT investigated the outbreak House to house survey done. 6 blood samples sent to DPL; result awaited. Entomological survey done. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from urban areas of Ektapuri Colony, Naka Guda Gudi, District Gwalior. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done. Blood smears tested negative for malaria. Water sample collected; result awaited. Health education given regarding safe drinking water and personal hygiene.

Cases of fever, cold reported from Village Damukial, SC Panigaon, Block PHC Nowboicha, District Lakhimpur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. All cases treated symptomatically. 64 blood slides tested for malaria were negative. Health awareness meetings were held in the community. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Murbad, SC Sayle, PHC Umroli, Block Dhasai, District Thane. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Cases treated locally. 15 blood smears collected were negative for malaria parasite. Vector control measures (anti larval and fogging) undertaken in the community. Health education given regarding personal protection.

Case reported form Village Veravilpur, PHC Paldi, Block Sheoganj, District Sirohi. District RRT investigated the outbreak. A 45 yr old male, shepherd by occupation, complained of mild fever for 10 days was admitted in Civil Hospital Ahmedabad. Patient tested positive for CCHF by Real Time RT-PCR in NIV, Pune. House to house survey done. No new cases found in the community. Intensive tick control measures undertaken. Health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village D.K.Thanda,SC Muttala, PHC Atmakur, CHC/Block Ananthapuramu, District Ananthapur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Symptomatic treatment given to all cases. Out of 4 blood samples collected, 2 samples were positive for typhoid by culture. Health education done regarding sanitation and safe drinking water.

Cases of fever with joint pain reported from Village/PHC Sogi, Block Hadagali, District Bellary. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Symptomatic treatment given to cases. 16 blood smears collected were negative for Malaria. 5 serum samples collected and sent to VIMS, Bellary; result awaited. Entomological survey done. Vector control measures undertaken. Health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Cases of fever with joint pain reported from Village Ballahunsi, PHC Hansi, Block HB Halli, District Bellary. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Symptomatic treatment given to cases. 42 blood smears collected were negative for Malaria. 5 serum samples collected and sent to VIMS, Bellary; result awaited. Entomological survey done (HI 7.2%, BI 7.2%). Fogging done in the community. Health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Cases of fever reported from Village Pulkhal , SC Kaneri, PHC Porla, Block / District Gadchirolli. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active survey done. All cases treated symptomatically. Blood smears tested negative for malaria. 16 serum samples sent to BMC Nagpur; result awaited. Entomological survey done.IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Haldri, SC Nagla, PHC Bihta, Block Barara, District Ambala . District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done. All cases treated symptomatically. All blood smears were negative for malaria. 2 samples sent for Enteric fever; tested negative.8 water samples sent; result awaited. 6 stool samples collected & sent to GH Ambala City Lab; result awaited. IEC done regarding safe drinking water and sanitation.

Cases of fever with cough reported from Village /SC Shalnard,PHC Sagam , Block Larnoo , District Anantnag. Block RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done. Symptomatic treatment given. 6 throat swab samples collected and sent to NCDC, Delhi for H1N1, all tested negative. Health education given regarding transmission and prevention of the respiratory infection.

Cases of fever reported from Village Tankipora, Kilam, PHC Kilam, Block Qazigund, District Kulgam. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active case search done. All cases treated symptomatically. Out of 2 water samples sent to Provincial Lab, JLNM Hospital, Srinagar, 1 water sample found to be non potable. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Pipaliya khaadi, Block Ashta, District Sehore. District RRT investigated survey done. All cases treated the outbreak. Active symptomatically. All blood smears tested negative for malaria. Vector control measures undertaken.IEC done regarding personal protective measures.

Cases of fever reported from Village Kalse, SC Dhamapur, PHC Chowke, Block Malvan, District Sindhudurg. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 8 water samples tested were non potable. 5 blood samples sent to DPHL, Sindhudurg tested negative for S.Typhi. All blood smears were negative for malaria. Anti- larval activities and fogging done. Entomological survey done. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Ganganapalya, PHC/CHC Hosakere, Block Gubbi, District Tumkur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Symptomatic treatment given. All blood smears tested negative for malaria. 6 serum samples sent to PHI, Bangalore; result awaited. Entomological survey done. Anti-larval activities and fogging done.IEC done regarding personal protective measures.

Cases of fever reported from Village Beerabbi, PHC / CHC Magala, Taluk Hadagalli, District Bellary. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done. Symptomatic treatment given. 08 blood smears negative for malaria. A total of 06 blood samples sent to VIMS, Bellary; result awaited. Entomological survey done .Source reduction and anti larval activities undertaken.IEC done.

Cases reported from Village Chikkathpuru, PHC/CHC Bannithalapura, Block Gundlupet, District Chamarajanagar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Temporary medical camps organized. All cases treated symptomatically. 5 blood samples collected and sent to District Lab, Chamarajanagar. Source reduction activities done. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Vaypur, SC Khlane, PHC Walkheda, Block Shindkheda, District Dhule. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. 13 serum samples collected for malaria testing and 10 serum samples taken for dengue testing; result awaited. Anti larval activities and fogging done in the affected area. IEC done regarding personal protective measures.

Cases of fever reported from Village/SC Laxmanpur, PHC Konsari, Block Chamurshi, District Gadchiroli. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. All 41 serum samples collected were negative for malaria. 13 serum samples collected and sent to IGMC Nagpur; result awaited. Anti larval activities and fogging done in the affected area. IEC done regarding personal protective measures.

Cases of fever reported from Village Borgaon, SC Khadaki, PHC Garkheda, Block Jamner, District Jalgaon. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Blood slide collected were negative for Malarial parasite. 5 serum samples collected for and sent to GMC Aurangabad for Dengue testing; result awaited. Entomological survey revealed: HI 17%, BI 25% and CI 6%. Anti larval activities and fogging done in the affected area. IEC done regarding personal protective measures.

Cases of fever reported from Village/SC Nagaralu, PHC/CHC Nidghatta, Block Kadur, Distict Chikmaglur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for fever cases done. All cases treated symptomatically. Blood samples and water samples collected and sent to SIMS, Shimoga. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from Village Sangodi, PHC Minumuluru, Mandal Paderu, District Vishakhapatnam. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Poor sanitary conditions were observed in the affected area. 12 blood smears were examined for malaria parasite; all were negative. Medical camp organized in the affected area. Chlorination of all water sources done. Health education given about dry day observation.

Cases of fever reported from Village Kuligam, Block Sogam, District Kupwara. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Out of 19 blood samples collected, 12 samples were positive for typhoid by widal. Symptomatic treatment given to cases. People advised to boil the water for drinking puposes. Health education given regarding safe drinking water, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases of fever reported from SC & PHC Penur, Block Loha, District Nanded. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Entomological survey was done in the affected area - HI 3.33%, BI 3.9%. All 16 blood slides were negative for malaria parasite. 4 serum samples were sent to MC Nanded; result awaited. Health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village Baradelepaly, Siddhanakatte,Block C N Halli, District Tumkur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All cases treated symptomatically. 6 blood smears and 3 serum samples collected; result awaited. Vector control measures (anti larval and fogging) undertaken in the community. Health education given regarding personal protection.

Cases of fever reported from Village Chorad, SC Gorwada, PHC Sindhkhed, Block Mahur, District Nanded. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Entomological survey done in the affected area - HI 35%, BI 60%. All 19 blood slides were negative for malaria parasite. 5 serum samples were sent to MC Nanded; result awaited. Fogging done Health education given on weekly dry day.

Cases of fever and upper abdominal pain reported from Ward No. 26, 9, Agarpara, Panihati Municipality, District North 24 Paraganas. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done. Cases treated symptomatically. Pipeline leakages were observed in the community. Out of 9 serum samples tested 4 samples were positive for typhoid by widal. Out of 3 water samples tested at Regional RG Kar Medical College, Kolkata 1 sample was non potable. Chlorination of water sources done. Pipeline leakages were repaired. Health education given regarding safe drinking water and sanitation.

Cases of fever reported from Block Akola, PHC Palso, HSC Babhulgaon, Village Dongragaon, Distt Akola. The cases presented with fever, headache and joint pain. A total of 16 blood samples were taken and sent to DMO Lab, 5 Serum samples were taken and sent to GMC Akola; result awaited. RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house surveillance was done. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from Block Madhuranthagam, PHC Nallamur, HSC Saravambakkam, Village Kolathur, district Kancheepuram. The total population of the affected area was 787 with 155 households. A total of 11 blood smears were tested for Malaria and all were negative. Fogging was done in the affected area.

Cases of fever reported from Village Dakhinpat, SC Machavaram, SC Borjoha, PHC Buragohathan, district Nagaon. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done. All cases treated symptomatically. 4 blood samples collected for blood culture and sent to GMCH Guwahati, result awaited. All the 7 water tested for H2S strip test were normal. Health education given regarding personal hygiene and sanitation.
Under surveillance

Cases of fever reported from Village Regulagadda, SC Osmnkunta, PHC/ Mandal Chandampet, district Nalgonda. All cases presented with high grade fever probably due to heat stroke. No evidence of mosquito breeding was observed. According to State a 29 year old female died due to condition. All 35 blood smears prepared were negative for malaria and 8 blood samples tested for Dengue and chikungunya were negative. 2 water samples tested for chemical parameters at IPM Hyderabad were also satisfactory. A medical camp was organized in the PHC and health education was given.

Cases of fever reported from Village Jajuru, PHC Banavara, Block Arsikere, district Hassan. DRRT investigated the outbreak. 31 blood slides were tested for MP all were negative. 2 blood samples were collected and tested for dengue and chikungunya by IgM ELISA; result awaited. 2 water samples were tested & found to be safe for drinking. Symptomatic treatment given. Health education given.

Current Status: Cases of fever reported from Surya Nursing College, 3rd cross garden area, Distt Shimoga. district RRT investigated the outbreak.Out of 38 blood samples tested at Ref Lab Shimoga, 26 were found to be positive for Typhoid by Widal test. IEC done on safe drinking water and food handling.

Cases of fever with body ache and joint pains reported from Village Basarkod, PHC Hirehal, Block Ron, and district Gadag. RRT investigated the outbreak. Out of 5 serum samples tested , one NS1 positive. A total of 21 peripheral blood smears collected; all negative for malaria. House to house entomological and fever survey done. Breeding of Aedes Aegypti found in nearly half of the houses surveyed. IEC activity and source reduction done. Treatment provided to cases.

Outbreak reported from Village Annenahalli, Jodigatta, Hirehalli, CHC Udayapura, Block CR Patna, district Hassan. DRRT investigated the outbreak. 55 blood slides were tested for MP all were negative. 5 blood samples were tested for dengue by Ig M ELISA, all were negative. 14 water samples were tested & found to be safe for drinking. Treatment was given. Health education given.

Comments/ Action Taken: Cases of fever from Pettugollapalli, Pedagummuluru, CHC Agraharam, PHC Penugollu, Mandal Nakkapalli, District Vishakhapatnam. Cases were reported from multiple villages, all these villages are located near to each other and all these villages have poor drainage system which is worsened by rains. Most of cases were clustered around open drains. A total of 37 blood slides were collected and sent to PHC Penugollu; negative for Malaria. Health education was given. Dry day was observed in the area.

Cases of fever with sore throat reported from Village/SC Ahamadbass, PHC Jhirka, District Mewat. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for cases done. Symptomatic treatment given to cases. Poor immunization status observed in the community. 04 throat swab samples sent to NCDC, Delhi found to be negative for diphtheria. IEC done.

Cases of fever reported from SC Shirasgaon Mozari, PHC Mardi, Block Tiosa, District Amravati. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All cases treated symptomatically. Increase in mosquito density observed in the community. 05 serum sample sent to Sentinel Lab Yavatmal tested negative for Dengue. 40 blood smears sent to Mardi Lab tested negative for malaria. One death occurred in a 17 year old female found Dengue IgM ELISA positive. Entomological survey & fever surveillance done. Anti larval activities and fogging done in the affected area. IEC done regarding personal protective measures.

Cases of fever reported from Village Indrayani Colony( Collector Patta), SC Sagameshwar, Block Malegaon, Sagameshwar Nagar Palika, District Nashik. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Symptomatic treatment given to cases. Increase in mosquito density observed in the community. 3 serum samples sent to Dhule Medical Collage tested negative for Dengue. 44 blood smears tested negative for malaria. One death occurred in a 44 year old female tested positive for Dengue by NS1, died due to the condition. Anti larval activities and fogging done in the affected area. IEC done regarding personal protective measures.

Cases reported from Village Chinapuliyampatty, SC Thandiyanenthal, PHC Mallankinar, Block Kariyapatty, District Virudhunagar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Anti larval activities and fogging done in the affected area. IEC done.

Fever survey done. Water containers were treated with Temephos. Guppy fish were introduced. Health education given regarding hygiene and sanitation.
