Cases reported from Pelhar City Area, Block Vasai. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 08 samples tested were negative for Malaria. All cases treated symptomatically. Source reduction activities undertaken. Health education given. Deceased was 21year old male child.

Case reported from Village Radhiwad Kampa, SC Radhiwad, PHC Unchidhanal Block Khedrahma. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 1 serum sample tested at NIV Pune was positive for CCHFV. Case treated symptomatically. Anti-tick activities carried out by animal husbandry department. Health education given.

Case reported from Village Radhiwad Kampa, SC Radhiwad, PHC Unchidhanal Block Khedrahma. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 1 serum sample tested at NIV Pune was positive for CCHFV. Case treated symptomatically. Anti-tick activities carried out by animal husbandry department. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Dasghat, SC Bijori, CHC /Block Khaknar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 05 serum samples tested at District Hospital Khandwa, tested negative for Chikungunya. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Dasghat, SC Bijori, CHC /Block Khaknar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 05 serum samples tested at District Hospital Khandwa, tested negative for Chikungunya. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from HUD Tiruppur, Block Madathukulam, PHC Kaniyur, HSC Karatholuvu, Village Karatholuvu. Cases presented with symptoms of fever, cold, myalgia. Seven setrum samples were sent to DPHL Tiruppur, all were negative for Dengue, Typhoid, Leptospirosis, Scrub typhus, Hepatitis A, Hepatitis-B. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from PHC Kunduthode, Village: Kavilumpara, Sub-District: Vatakara, District: Kozhikode. Cases presented with symptoms of fever and headache after attending a wedding on 20.01.2024. All age groups were affected. Three stool samples were sent to IQRAA Thottilppalam & Govt. Med. College Kozhikode, all were found to be positive for S. Typhi on culture. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Village Tarajuli Tea Estate, Sub-District Chariduar, District Sonitpur. Cases presented with fever. 13 blood samples were collected and sent to DPHL Sonitpur. All the samples came negative for malaria, dengue, Hepatitis, Japanese Encephalitis and Leptospirosis. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Village Tarajuli Tea Estate, Sub-District Chariduar, District Sonitpur. Cases presented with fever. 13 blood samples were collected and sent to DPHL Sonitpur. All the samples came negative for malaria, dengue, Hepatitis, Japanese Encephalitis and Leptospirosis. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases were treated symptomatically. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Village: Jambusar, Sub-District: Jambusar, District: Bharuch. Cases presented with high-grade fever and abdominal pain. The affected age group was 10- 40 years. Total 59 serum samples were sent to SDH Jambusar, all 59 samples were positive for Widal. Four blood samples were also sent to District Hospital Bharuch for blood culture for typhoid, all were negative. Total 9 water samples were collected from different areas of Jambusar City and sent to Jambusar WASMO for bacteriological examination. All were fit for potable use. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from TNT Zuangtui, Aizawl under Zemabawk UPHC, District: Aizawl. Cases presented with symptoms of fever, stomach pain and diarrhea. The affected age group was 21 to 41 years. Two water samples were sent to Microbiology Department, Civil Hospital, Aizawl, which were found to be unfit for drinking. Total 39 blood samples were also sent for testing, out of which 11 were reactive for typhoid by TyphiDot/ Rapid Card test. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation. Death of a 24 year old male has occurred on 17.3.2024 due to the illness.

Cases reported from Village Appargudi, HSC Katchanam, PHC Thiruthangoor, Block Thiruthuraipoondi, District Thiruvarur. Cases presented with symptoms of fever. Total 5 serum & 2 water samples were sent to DPHL, Thiruvarur. Three serum samples were positive for Leptospirosis IgM by ELISA. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral health team on hygiene, and sanitation. Health education imparted regarding the spread of disease. Active fever surveillance was done. IEC regarding Do's & Don’ts of Leptospirosis was done.

Cases were reported from Sub-District Veldurthi, District Palnadu. Cases presented with fever with body pain and joint pain. 58 blood samples were collected and tested negative for Malaria and Dengue by rapid test at the medical camp. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases treated symptomatically. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Sub-District Veldurthi, District Palnadu. Cases presented with fever with body pain and joint pain. 58 blood samples were collected and tested negative for Malaria and Dengue by rapid test at the medical camp. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases treated symptomatically. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases were reported from Sub-District Patan, District Patan. Cases presented with fever, nausea and weakness. 5 blood samples and 3 water samples were collected and sent to Dharpur lab and WASMO lab respectively. 3 blood samples came positive for salmonella typhi. All the water samples found unfit for the potable purpose. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on hygiene and sanitation.

Cases reported from Betguri Village, North Jamuguri, Sonitpur. Cases presented with fever. Ten blood samples were collected & sent to DPHL, KCH Sonitpur, all were negative for Malaria, Typhoid, Dengue, and Leptospirosis. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on vector control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases reported from Nityananda BPHC, Dolar Pathar Village under Dolar Pathar AAM, Bajali District. Cases presented with fever. Total 15 blood samples were tested, all were negative for Malaria by RDK. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team regarding diseases like Malaria, Japanese Encephalitis and Dengue.

Cases reported from Nityananda BPHC, Dolar Pathar Village under Dolar Pathar AAM, Bajali District. Cases presented with fever. Total 15 blood samples were tested, all were negative for Malaria by RDK. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team regarding diseases like Malaria, Japanese Encephalitis and Dengue.

Cases were reported from CHC Jafarabad, Village: Vadli, Sub-District: Jafarabad, District: Amreli. Cases presented with symptoms of fever. Four blood samples were tested at CHC Jafarabad lab, all were positive on Widal test. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Community awareness and health education given by peripheral team on control measures, hygiene and sanitation.

Cases of fever reported from Village Maruthur, PHC Puthuruthamanur, Block Lalgudi. 5 blood serum samples collected and sent to KAPV Medical College, Trichy for testing for Leptospirosis and Typhoid; of which 2 tested positive for Typhoid by WIDAL test. Instruction given to the local administrative authorities for cleaning and disinfecting the water storage tanks immediately. All cases treated symptomatically. House to house visit done to find new cases. IEC activities undertaken regarding safe drinking water, hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Cases clinically diagnosed as Typhoid, reported from G.H.P. School, Village Veeraganahalli, PHC Pattanayakanahall, Taluk Sira. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. Out of 2 blood samples sent for blood culture, one tested positive for S. typhi. Chlorination of water sources done. IEC activities undertaken regarding safe drinking water, hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Outbreak reported from Village Chikkahedagihalli, PHC Chelur, Taluk Gubbi. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. Out of 5 blood samples sent for blood culture and WIDAL test, one tested positive for WIDAL and all tested negative for culture. Health education given regarding hygiene and sanitation.

Cases of fever reported from Eldico Security Phase -2, PHC Utrethia, CHC Sarojninagar due to consumption of contaminated water caused by leakage in water pipeline. All cases tested positive for WIDAL test at SGPGI, Lucknow. Active house to house survey conducted to find new cases. Leakage in water pipeline repaired. IEC activities undertaken regarding safe drinking water, hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Outbreak reported from Village Mohdura, PHC Titur. District RRT visited and investigated the outbreak. Out of 28 blood samples collected, 17 tested positive for WIDAL test. Water samples sent for lab testing; result awaited. Active house to house survey conducted to find new cases. All cases treated. ORS packets and chlorine tablets distributed in the locality. Cases treated. Leakage in water pipeline repaired. Health education given regarding hygiene and sanitation.

Cases of fever reported from Village Vajawane, PHC Kude, Block Khed, of District Pune. 5 blood serum samples collected and sent to DPHL. Instruction given to the local administrative authorities for cleaning and disinfecting the water storage tanks. All cases treated symptomatically. House to house visit done to find new cases. IEC activities undertaken regarding safe drinking water, hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Outbreak reported from Village Pathar Kachar, Block Majhigawan, District Satna. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All cases treated symptomatically. Temporary medical camps organized. House to house visit done to find new cases. IEC activities undertaken regarding hygienic practices and sanitation measures

Cases reported from Village Panaikudi, SC Iruvarkulam, PHC Kattanoor, Block Narikudi, District Virudhunagar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 8 serum samples taken and sent to ZET (Zonal Entomological Lab), Virudhunagar: results awaited. Source reduction and fogging operations undertaken. Chlorination of water sources done. Pipeline breakages repaired. IEC activities undertaken regarding safe drinking water, hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Cases of fever reported from Village Chikkakabbigere, PHC Muddapura, Block Chitradurga. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Treatment of patients done at PHC Muddapura. 27 blood smears for malaria along with 5 blood samples for Widal and 3 for Dengue collected and tested at District Referral Lab, Chitradurga out of which all samples tested negative for respective tests. IEC activities undertaken regarding personal protection and hygiene maintenance done.

Outbreak reported from PHC Banaganahally, Block Akkur Hosahally. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 28 blood slides collected and examined at District Lab, Ramanagara. All slides tested negative for Malaria. Health education given regarding personal protection.

Outbreak reported from Village Chikkakabbigere, PHC Muddapura, Taluka Chitradurga. District RRT visited and investigated the outbreak. 5 serum samples collected. Samples tested for Widal and Dengue. All samples tested negative for respective tests. 27 Malaria slides prepared. All slides tested negative for malaria. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Kanoor, PHC Poovandhi, District Sivaganga. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 4 Serum Samples collected and sent to ZET, Virudhnagar; results awaited. All cases treated. Fogging, Anti larval and source reduction activities done. Health education given regarding personal protection.

Cases reported from Village & SC Ahatguri, PHC & Block Jhargaon, District Marigaon. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Mass fever survey done for fever cases. All cases treated symptomatically. 14 blood slides collected which tested negative for Malaria parasite. IEC activities done regarding personal protection.

Cases reported from village Karungan Kottai, HSC Anchoor, PHC Jegadevi, Block Bargur, District Krishnagiri. District RRT and investigated the outbreak. 4 samples sent to IVCZ, Hosur. The samples tested positive for Typhoid by culture. Active supervision started by Block RRT team. Chlorination of local water sources and disinfection activities undertaken. Safe drinking water provided to local population. Health education given.

Outbreak reported from Village Dardpora, CHC & Block Kreeri, District Baramulla. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All cases treated at CHC Kreeri. 10 serum samples collected and sent to State Public Health Lab Barzulla, Srinagar which tested positive for Typhoid by IgM Typhidot. Health Education given regarding safe drinking water and sanitation.

Cases reported from Gopal Nagar, Najafgarh, District South-West, Delhi. Medical team from VMMC (Vardhman Mahavir Medical College) and Safdarjung Hospital visited the area and investigated the outbreak. Approximately 1000 households were surveyed and a total of 29 cases of Typhoid and 18 case of Jaundice were found by the RRT. 54 water samples collected by Delhi Jal Board. All of them found to be bacteriologically satisfactory with acceptable residual chlorine concentration. Blood samples sent to Safdarjung Hospital; result awaited. Chlorine tablets distributed. IEC done.

Outbreak reported from Village Borigaon, SC Utterbetna, PHC Naokata, Block Nizkaurbaha, District Baksa. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search of fever cases done by paramedical staff. Out of 102 blood samples tested for Malaria smear, none was positive for Malaria. The death reported was Malaria (PF) positive case. Insecticide residual spray done in the affected area. 500 Long Lasting Insecticidal Nets were distributed in the affected area. IEC done.

Outbreak reported from town area of Block Sindhanur, District Raichur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 51 serum samples collected and sent to Vijayanagar Institute of Medical Sciences and Hospital, Bellary; result awaited. Entomological survey done. Source reduction activities and fogging done in the affected area. IEC undertaken.

Outbreak reported from Village Kurund, PHC Pedgha, Block Bhiwandi, District Thane. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 5 blood samples taken and sent to Sentinal Center, Thane. The rapid test for Dengue performed in Civil Hospital, Thane tested negative. 54 blood smear tested negative for Malaria parasite. Active Daily Surveillance for new fever cases initiated. Anti-adult activities along with application of temiphos (for anti-larval activity) done. Health Education regarding water storage and cleanliness given.

Cases reported from Village Sujilkarai, SC Sujilkarai, PHC Geermalam, Block Talavady, District Erode. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 24 blood smears prepared and tested negative for malaria. Tests also done for Leptospirosis and Typhoid. Health education given.

Outbreak reported from Village Borkheda, CHC Pandhana, Block Pandhana, District Khandwa. Block health team investigated the outbreak. All cases treated locally. 50 blood slides collected, all of which tested negative for malaria parasite. Spraying of Pyrerthrum done in the affected area. IEC activities done regarding personal protection.

Cases reported from Village Sirukudi, PHC Melasirupothu, Block Kadaladi, District Ramanathapuram. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 10 Blood smear collected and sent to PHC Lab, Melasirupothu; result awaited. Door to door fever surveillance and Anti larval work with Abate application done. Treatment for all fever cases at affected area ensured. Fogging operations done. Health education given.

Outbreak reported from Village Jogikal, PHC Bandri, Block Sandur, District Bellary. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Blood slides were negative for Malaria. House to house survey done. Serum samples collected for testing for Dengue and Chikungunya; result awaited. Temporary clinic established in the village. Halogen tablets distributed in the community. Chlorination of water sources done. IEC done.

Cases reported from District Nadia, SD Tehatta, Block Karimpur- I, GP Harekrishnapur, Village Jayrampur. Block medical team visited the area and investigated the outbreak. All have taken treatment at nearest health centers. Health education given.

Outbreak reported from Village Dangiwacha, Block Rawcho, District Baramulla. District and State RRT investigated the outbreak. Treatment of patients done. Cases were above 10 years of age. Out of 66 serum samples tested, 15 were positive for Widal test. 12 Blood samples collected and sent to Public Health Lab, Srinagar for serology and culture out of which 4 samples tested positive for Typhoid by Rdk Typhidot. 2 blood samples tested negative for Typhoid by culture. Health education imparted to the public.

Outbreak reported from Village Mudradi and Hebri, PHC/CHC Hebri, Block Karkala, District Udupi. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Out of 10 serum samples tested 9 samples were widal positive. Awareness of drinking boiled water done at household level. Chlorination of wells done. Health Education given regarding personnel cleanliness.

Outbreak of fever and joint pains reported from Village Begechapada, PHC Khardi, Block Shahapur, District Thane. District RRT visited the area and investigated the outbreak. 22 blood slides collected, all of which tested negative for Malaria. 5 blood serum samples sent to NIV Pune for further testing. Samples tested negative for Dengue and Chikungunya. Active surveillance for new fever cases ongoing. IEC activities conducted.

A resident of Village Kocharia, suspected to be a case of Crimean Congo Hemorrhagic Fever (CCHF) was admitted in Trimurti Hospital on 12th June 2012. Subsequently the case was referred to VS General Hospital, Ahemdabad where the case was clinically diagnosed as CCHF. The case died on 17th June 2012. No samples of the case were taken for lab confirmation. A Medical Doctor, who did intubation of the above case, presented symptoms of high grade fever, headache, anorexia, and metallic taste on 19th June 2012. And he later expired on 22nd June 2012. Samples of the above doctor were tested positive for CCHF. The third case was a ward boy in the VS General Hospital who was in contact with the first and second case. He developed symptoms of fever and decreased urine output on 22nd June 2012 and later diagnosed as acute renal failure. The fourth case who was in contact with the doctor is undergoing treatment in the hospital. Surveillance strengthened within the 5km radius of the affected area. House to house survey done. Co-ordination with animal husbandry department has been established. 14 blood samples of animals were collected. 3 samples of ticks were taken. Deltamethrin spray done. Instructions given to all concerned departments and persons for maintenance of personal hygiene, six-step hand washing, keeping cattle clean, general sanitation measures, and reporting of symptomatic cases. Proper disposal of biomedical wastes and measures to safeguard health of health personal undertaken. IEC given to private practitioners to follow CCHF protocol and undertake universal precautions while treating patients. IEC in general population strengthened with the help of health staff, ASHA and Anganwadi workers.

Outbreak reported from Village Meerikarnahalli, PHC/CHC M.M.Wada, Block Hadagali, District Bellary. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to House active fever survey of cases done. 28 blood smears collected and tested negative for Malaria parasite. 3 samples collected and sent to District lab for Chikungunya test; result awaited. Aedes larval surveillance and fogging done. IEC activities done.

Cases of fever, bodyache, pain in abdomen and nausea reported from Village Bela ki Puliya, SC Karahiya, PHC Chinor, Block Bhitarwar, District Gwalior. Block RRT investigated the outbreak. 6 blood slides prepared for examination, results awaited. IEC activities done.

Cases reported from Village Kijpora, District Ganderbal. Block health team visited the affected area. People live in unhygienic and poor sanitary condition. Symptomatic treatment given to all patients. 14 serum samples collected out of which 8 samples tested positive for Widal test. 3 Blood samples collected and sent to Public Health Lab, Srinagar which tested negative for Typhoid by culture. Health education given and chlorine tablets distributed in the locality.

Outbreak reported from Village Theronda, PHC Revdanda, Block Alibag, District Raigad. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Entomological survey revealed; HI 26.1, BI 50, Adult mosquito density 5. 6 serum sample collected and sent to NIV Pune; result awaited. 43 blood smears were negative for malaria.

Outbreak reported from Village Perammagaripally, SC Puliveedu, PHC Porumamilla, District Kadapa. Medical team investigated the outbreak. 17 Blood smears collected and tested, all were found negative for malaria. House to house survey done. The team found larval breeding sites in the affected village. Anti larval activities, spraying Pyrethrum and fogging with Malathion done in the affected area. Health camp organized in the village. Disinfection of the surrounding villages done by Village Panchayat.

Cases of fever with joint pain reported from Village Chandipos, SC Tunia, Block Sonua, District West Singhbhum. Block health team visited the affected area. Active search for fever cases done by paramedical team. All cases treated symptomatically. Source reduction measures carried out in the affected area. IEC activities undertaken regarding early treatment of cases and personal protection measures.

Outbreak reported from Village Manapparai, SC Maravanur, PHC K.Udaiyapatti, District Tiruchirapalli. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Community practiced storing of water. Containers found positive for Aedes larva on house to house search. 20 Blood smear found negative for malaraia parasite. 10 serum samples collected and sent to SE/ZET & KAPV Govt. Medical College Trichy for analysis of Dengue / Chikungunya / Leptospirosis; result awaited. Source reduction activity done. Indoor thermal fogging operation done. IEC has been given to community to cover the cistern with air proof lid and clean the container in two times per week.

Cases reported from Village & SC Sunaiyakadu, PHC Maramadakki, Block Aranthangi, District Pudukottai. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All cases treated locally. 6 serum samples collected and sent to ZET Trichy; result awaited. House to house survey done. Antilarval activities and fogging done in the affected area. Health education given.

Outbreak reported from Village Vendurayapuram, SC Saminatham, PHC Maraneri, Block Sivakasi, District Virudhnagar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. 14 blood smears were negative for Malaria. 4 serum samples collected; result awaited. Anti larval and fogging operations done. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village/SC/PHC Der, District Patan. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Fever survey done. 2 serum samples collected and sent to B.J. Medical Ahmedabad; result awaited. Anti larval activity done. IEC activities done.

Outbreak reported from Village Wave, PHC Revdanad, Block Alibag, District Raigad. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Entomological survey revealed; House index 11.9, Breateaux index 21.4, Container index 5.3 and Adult mosquito 3.6. 6 serum samples collected and sent to NIV Pune; result awaited. 25 blood smears collected which tested negative for Malaria. Fogging done. Health education given.

Outbreak reported from Village and SC Edaiyathi , PHC Kuruchi, Distrcit Thanjavur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Out of 3 serum sample collected, 1 was positive for both Dengue and Chikungunya ( IgM ELISA). Anti larval and anti adult control measures taken.
Outbreak reported from Village Ayyanar colony, PHC Maraneri. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Out for 4 serum samples collected, none was positive for Dengue, Chikungunya and Leptospirosis.

Outbreak reported from Village Lingampally, SC Miryala PHC Nuthankal, District Nalgonda. Medical team investigated the outbreak. 82 blood smears were negative for malaria. All 8 blood serum samples collected tested negative for Dengue. Health education given.

Outbreak reported from Village Bahirkhed, SC Dahigaon, PHC Palso, Block Akola, Distrcit Akola. Distrcit RRT investigated the outbreak. Chlorine tablets distributed in the community. 25 blood smears collected, tested negative for malaria. 2 serum sample collected and sent to GMC, Akola; result awaited. IEC done.

Outbreak reported from Village Kawadgaon PHC Wadwani Block Wadwani, Distrct Beed. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Temporary health camps organized in the community. 32 blood smears collected, tested negative for malaria. All 5 serum samples collected tested negative for Chikungunya and Dengue (IgM ELISA). Control measures taken.

Outbreak reported from Village, SC & PHC Nashirabad, Block and District Jalgaon. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Entomological survey revealed: House Index 36, Container Index 22 and Breateaux Index 55. 28 blood smears collected were negative for malaria parasite. All the 4 serum samples collected tested negative for Dengue and Chikungunya (IgM ELISA). Medical camps organized. Antilarval activities (Abate solution) and fogging done. Awareness among people about dry day and vector control activities done.

Outbreak reported from Village Echur, SC Panrutti, PHC Sriperumbudur, Block and District Kancheepuram. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All the blood smears collected were negative for Malaria. Serum Samples sent to King Institute; result awaited. Anti larval activities and fogging done. IEC done.

Outbreak reported from Village Vattathikottaikovilakadu, SC Vattathikottai, PHC Kuruchi, Block Peravurani, District Thanjavur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All 3 serum sample collected and tested negative for Dengue. Anti larval activities and fogging done.

Outbreak reported from Village Kumri, SC Syor, Block Jakholi, District Rudraprayag. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Active search for new cases done. Symptomatic treatment given to cases. 8 blood samples collected and sent to District Hospital, out of which 7 blood samples tested positive for Widal. Chlorination of water sources done. Health education given regarding safe drinking water, hygiene and sanitation.

Outbreak reported from Block Kumarganj, District Dakshin Dinajpur. District RRT & Block health team investigated the outbreak. Out of 193 cases; 184 cases were of fever and 9 cases were of Acute Encephalitis Syndrome (till 12th September 2012). Symptomatic treatment provided to cases. All the blood smears collected were negative for malaria parasite. 89 Serum sample collected and sent to NBMCH Darjeeling. 6 were positive for Dengue, 1 sample positive for Chikungunya and 2 samples were positive for JE. And further 69 samples were collected and sent to NBMCH Darjeeling; result awaited. Medical camps organized. IEC activities done.

Outbreak reported from Village and SC Khamagaon, PHC Doki, Block & District Osmanabad. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All cases treated locally. 9 serum samples collected and sent to SSH; result awaited. Antilarval activities done.

Cases reported from Village Horpada, PHC Borkund, Block & District Dhule. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All cases treated locally. 4 serum samples collected and sent to GMC, Dhule; result awaited. Health education given.

Outbreak reported from Villages Sarya kachawa and Pillkhana, SC Chanduali PHC & Block Airwakatra, District Auraiya. Medical team investigated the outbreak. All cases treated locally. 50 blood smears collected out of which 3 were positive for malaria. IEC done regarding personal protection.

Outbreak reported from Village & PHC H.Hipparagi, Block Bagewadi, District Bijapur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Source reduction activity and fogging done. IEC activity is done.

Outbreak reported from Villages & SCs Gadegaon, Loni Warud, Ekdara and Deutwada, Block Warud, District Amravati. Medical team investigated the outbreak. 21 serum samples collected and sent NIV and SSH; result awaited. A central team from NCDC, Delhi visited the affected area. Control measures undertaken.

Outbreak reported from urban area Guruwarpeth of Ambajogai, District Beed. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Temporary health camp organized. All 17 serum samples collected were negative for Dengue and Chikunguyna.

Outbreak reported from Village Karanja kondripada, PHC Koproli, Block Uran District Raigad. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Entomological survey revealed high vector indices, Adult Aedes density 3 HI 21.4, BI 38.0, CI 14.8. 14 serum sample collected sent to NIV; result awaited. All the 18 blood smear collected were negative for Malaria. Fogging done. Health education imparted.
Outbreak reported from Village Chowki Jattan, SC Jol Sapper, Block Nadaun, District Hamirpur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All cases treated locally. IEC done.

Cases reported from Village Pashwal (Gujar Basti), PHC Kullar, Block Sallar, District Anantnag. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Symptomatic treatment given to cases. 8 blood samples collected which tested negative for Widal. Health education given regarding safe drinking water, hygiene and sanitation.

Outbreak reported from Village Khalapuri, PHC Khalapuri, Block Shirur, District Beed. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Aedes mosquito breeding sites and larva identified in the community. Health camp organized in the community. Control measures undertaken.

Outbreak reported from Village Nane, PHC Borkund, Block & District Dhule. Medical team investigated the outbreak. High vector density (Aedes larva) observed in the community. House to house survey done. Temporary medical camps organized. All cases treated locally. Anti-larval activities and fogging done. Dry day observed in the community. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Deepnagar, SC Deepnagar, PHC Kathorar, Block Bhusawal, District Jalgaon, District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 19 blood smears collected were negative for malaria parasite. Medical camps organized. Anti larval operations and fogging done. Awareness on vector control activities imparted.

Outbreak reported from Village Sheri, SC Pathrad, PHC Chandsar, Block Dharangaon, District Jalgaon. People adopted water storage practices. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Entomological survey revealed high vector indices, HI 40, CI 16, BI 51. Health camps organized. All 29 blood smears were negative for Malaria parasite. 4 serum samples collected and send to NIV, result awaited. Anti-larval operations, pyrethrum spray and fogging done in the community. Health education given.

Cases of fever with joint pain reported from Village Mundhal, SC Bodimettu, PHC Silamalai, Block Bodinayakanur, District Theni. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Aedes vector survey revealed high vector indices, House Index - 9.5, Container Index - 9.0, Breteaux Index - 10.1. 15 serum samples collected and sent to Govt Medical College, Theni; result awaited. 3 blood smears collected were negative for malaria parasite. All cases treated. Source reduction and fogging done. IEC done.

Cases reported from Village Thiruverumbur, SC Keelakurichi, PHC Thiruvalarchipatti, Block Chellamuthupuram, Distrcit Tiruchirapalli. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All cases treated. 6 serum samples collected and sent to ZET, Trichy; result awaited. All 12 blood smear collected were negative for malaria parasite. Source reduction and fogging done. IEC done.

Cases of fever with joint pain reported from Village Perappanthangal, SC Peramandur, PHC Muppuli, Block Mailam, Distrcit Villupuram. Medical team investigated the outbreak. All cases treated locally. 5 serum samples collected and sent to Mundiampakkam Medical college hospital; results awaited. Health education given.

All cases treated locally. 25 blood samples collected out of which 4 samples tested positive for Widal. All samples were negative for malaria. Chlorine tablets distributed in the community. Outbreak reported from Village Palasab, PHC Palasab, Block Jagji, District Osmanabad. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. All cases treated. Outbreak reported from Village Gotsai, SC Maniwalli, PHC Dahagaon,. Block Kalyan, District Thane. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. Outbreak reported from Kashipur area due to consumption of polluted water from local ponds. Cases presented with high fever and pain abdomen, clinically diagnosed as typhoid. Health education given regarding sanitation and hygiene.

Cases reported from T.Rajagobalanpatti village, Block Aundipatti, PHC T.Subulapuram, People presented with body pain, inability to walk, and rashes over body. Entomological survey revealed storage of water in cement tank, water logging in tires and cisterns. Source reduction measures carried out. Indoor fogging operation for 3 days done. Sanitation measures undertaken. Blood smears collection from all fever cases in the village. Result awaited.

Outbreak reported from Ceylon Refugee Camp, PHC Chatrapatty. Blood smear taken for fever cases and found negative for Malaria. Blood serum samples were collected for 5 cases and examined at GPHC lab, K.Keeranur. Out of 5, 3 cases were found positive for Typhoid. House to house survey done. Chlorination of water, Environmental sanitation done. Health education given.

Cases reported from Thollamur Village, PHC Pombur, Block Killyanur District RRT visited the affected area. Blood smear collected for investigation, result awaited. Fever surveillance carried out. IEC activities undertaken, Fogging and anti larval work carried out.

Outbreak reported from Pullakkapatti Village, PHC Devathanapatti, Block Periakulam. Cases presented with conjjunctival suffusion, retro-orbital pain, headache, body pain, swelling of hands and legs, not able to walk and fever. Abate application in all water sources done. Source reduction carried out. Indoor fogging operation for 3 days organized. Blood smears collected for lab examination for leptospirosis, dengue, typhoid fever and chikungunya and instructed to hand over to TVC&Z Hosure for lab investigation. Health education provided to people.

Outbreak reported from Bilaspur Madhotanda, Puranpur. District RRT visited the affected area. Provide Health education to all villagers. Advised people to improve sanitation. ORS packets distributed among villagers.

Cases of fever reported from PHC Muthupettai. Mass fever survey done and sera samples collected for lab analysis; result awaited. Health education given regarding personal protection measures and hygienic practices.

Outbreak reported from village Cherukkanur, PHC Beerakuppam probably due to consumption of contaminated water. Out of 10 blood samples tested at Govt. Hospital, Tiruvallur, 7 samples tested positive for Typhoid (WIDAL test) only and 2 samples tested positive both for Typhoid and Leptospirosis. Medical team deployed to affected area and local Panchayat body instructed regarding village sanitation and disinfection of water sources. Chemoprophylatic antibiotic therapy given to all fever cases. Health education given regarding personal hygiene and importance of drinking boiled water. House to house survey done for new fever cases.

Comments/ Action Taken

Cases reported from Village Rangundla, Mandal Thirumalgiri Sagar, PHC Hailya. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Majority of cases had generalized body, knee & joint pains. It was observed that there is very poor sanitation and personal hygiene, with all villages using open toilets. 12 blood smears collected and 10 RDT tests done for Malaria (PV&PF). Results shows all are negative. 06 sera samples tested for Dengue by IgM ELISA at District Hospital., Nalgonda. Results tested negative. Medical camp and house to house survey done. Awareness to maintain the personal hygiene about dry day and environmental sanitation. District Malaria team conducted fogging and spray for anti-malarial measures. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Tenduai Kala, Residential Kasturba School. Block Jahangirpur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 05 Blood samples collected. Result Awaited. Isolation of affected students, sensitization for hand washing practices, All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases of fever were reported from KGBV School, HSC Sunder Nagar, Block Jugsalai cum Golmuri. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 40 blood samples collected were negative for Malaria (RD Kit). All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases of fever with sore throat reported from Village Harbaroda SC Arrod Block Vijaypur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. District and block RRT visited the area. History of fever ranges from 03 to 05 days. Cases belonged to 2 years to 7 years. 02 serum samples sent to GRMC Gwalior were not confirmatory. Medical camp organized and cases treated symptomatically. Relevant health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village Moti Chovisis, SC Chovisi, PHC Chovsi, Block Navsari. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 07 serum samples sent to DPHL Nayan; samples were negative for Dengue and Chikunguniya. Fogging with Pyrethrum done in the house of cases. All cases treated symptomatically. Relevant health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village Moti Chovisis, SC Chovisi, PHC Chovsi, Block Navsari. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 07 serum samples sent to DPHL Nayan; samples were negative for Dengue and Chikunguniya. Fogging with Pyrethrum done in the house of cases. All cases treated symptomatically. Relevant health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village Muthyalammagudem street, PHC Chityal. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 08 sera samples and 14 blood smears were negative for common organisms for fever. All cases treated symptomatically. Anti larval measures and source reduction undertaken. Health awareness given to people on personal protection measures.

Cases reported from Village Loni, SC Sawanga, PHC Loni, Block Aarni. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Increase in mosquito larva density. Viral fever symptoms observed in village. Rapid fever survey done. Symptomatic treatment of fever patient done. Temiphos was applied for larval control along with cleanness activity in the villages. IEC activity. Two blood sample taken for malaria, Result is negative. All cases treated symptomatically.

30 Cases of fever reported from Village/PHC Nipani Jawalka, Taluk. Georai; further 21 more cases reported from Village Mirkala, SC Gadhi in 43rd week ending on 25th October 2015. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. 05 Blood samples collected and sent to laboratory for Dengue & Chikungunya ELISA; result awaited. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

51 Cases of fever reported from Village/PHC Nipani Jawalka, & Village Mirkala, SC Gadhi Taluk. Georai till 43rd week ending on 25th October 2015; further 26 more cases reported in 44th week ending on 01st November 2015. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. 05 Blood samples collected and sent to laboratory for Dengue & Chikungunya ELISA; result awaited. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Nangalbhawana, Block Kherli, PHC Bhatukala, SC Jadala. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey conducted. A total of 12 samples collected and sent to District Central Lab. All cases were treated symptomatically. Fogging done, antilarval activities undertaken. Health education given.

Cases of fever, loose motion, vomiting reported from Village Bartheda Khurd, Block Binaganj, District Guna due to consumption of contaminated water (pipeline leakage). District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Out of 125 cases 40 were fever cases. All case treated. 26 blood smears and 22 samples by rapid diagnostic kit for malaria were negative for malaria parasite. Chlorination of water sources done. ORS packets distributed in the community. Alternate source of drinking water supplied.

Cases of fever, body ache, cold and cough reported from Village Keata, Block Dugadda, District Pauri. Block health team investigated the outbreak. Active search of cases done. Medical camp established in the village. Symptomatic treatment given to cases. 6 blood smears collected were negative for malaria. Chlorine tablets and bleaching powder distributed. IEC regarding personal and environmental hygiene given.

Cases reported from Village Laii, Chingmai Khunou, Vaisiichu, PHC Laii, District Senapati. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house fever survey done. All 20 blood smears collected were negative for malaria. Cases treated locally. Health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village/SC Kokangaon, PHC Pimalgaon, Block Niphad, District Nashik. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Cases treated locally. 32 peripheral blood smears collected were tested negative for malaria parasite. 13 serum samples collected; result awaited. Entomological survey revealed I=16.66%, HI=18.91%, BI=24.32%; Adult Aedes density = 8.4. Pyrethrum spray and Abate application done. Health education regarding personal protective measures and environmental measures done.

Outbreak reported from Midnapur Municipality Ward no. 11, Goalapara, Mirzabazar, Midnapur Sadar. District RRT visited the affected area. Blood slides drawn from all fever cases and contacts and sent to MMCH for investigation found negative for Malaria. Entomological survey done for Aedes larvae in water containers; however, no larvae found. Sera samples for Chikungunya and Dengue sent to STM (Student Tropical Medicine); ELISA for Dengue tested negative, and report awaited for Chikungunya. Intensive spraying done in the affected locality. Medical camp organized at the affected area. A medical team visited the locality and treated the fever cases symptomatically. IEC activities undertaken regarding personal protection measures and vector control measures.

Outbreak reported from Melapalayam Urban Health Post. Entomological survey done for Aedes mosquitoes; the various entomological indices were HI: 12.7%, CI: 29%, and BI: 13%. House to house search done for new cases. Four mobile teams conducted camps for treatment of cases and fogging operation. Temephos application done. Sera samples sent for lab analysis; result awaited.

Outbreak reported from Chikkabandapalli Village, PHC Alangur, Taluka Mulgabal. District RRT visited the affected area. Blood smears tested negative for malaria parasite. On serological analysis of four sera samples at sentinel laboratory, all tested negative for Chikungunya and one tested positive for Dengue only. Entomological survey revealed Aedes aegypti larvae in one cement tank. Temporary clinic set up and survey is under process. All cases treated symptomatically.

Outbreak reported from Village Thuravi, PHC Radhapuram, Block Vikkiravandi. 30 blood smear taken, tested negative for Malaria. District RRT visited the affected area. Fever surveillance carried out, and IEC activities undertaken. Symptomatic treatment given.

Cases with fever reported from Village Sarangi (Mithapur) sub centre Dhangar, Takli, PHC Kantheshwar, Taluka Purna. District RRT visited the affected area. House to house rapid fever survey done. Aedes mosquito larva found on container survey. 20 blood samples and 5 sera samples collected and sent to Govt. Medical College, Aurangabad for lab investigation; result awaited. Cases being treated symptomatically. IEC activities conducted.

All cases are children in age-group of 1-9 yrs, from village Sekteya, Kakan, Sokikat Block, presenting with symptoms of sudden pain abdomen, chest pain, breathing difficulty and some with fever and dysentry. The six deaths among these occurred within 24 hrs of onset of symptoms with frothing and bleeding from nose noticed at the time of death. The first death occurred on 16.02.10 and the last death was reported on 16.03.10. The cause of death is being ascertained. Two cases are being treated at Sadar Hospital, Araria; and their chest X-ray shows evidence of rapidly spreading viral lung infection. Reports of some poultry deaths have also been received from the same area. District RRT investigating the outbreak. Physical examination of all villagers done and symptomatic treatment given. Health education given regarding sanitation, hygienic practices and personal protection measures. Outbreak investigation team from medical college is being deputed to the affected site for health care management.

Cases reported from HP Rani CHC (villages Chaubey Purwa, Gulra) and Gilaula CHC (village Dugaahra). Two children died due to pneumonia. All cases presented with fever and respiratory tract illness. District RRT visited the affected area. Cases treated symptomatically and health education given regarding hygienic practices.

Outbreak reported from Village Kagal, Taluka Kagal. District RRT members visited affected area to investigate the outbreak. House to house survey done for new fever cases. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given regarding hygienic practices.

Outbreak reported from Village Chapat, Muslim para & Ghosh para, Nadia/Sadar Sub division, Kaliganj Block. Block RRT visited the affected area to investigate the outbreak. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given regarding sanitation, hygienic practices and personal protection measures.

Outbreak reported from village Mohala, sub centre Khadka, PHC Sonpeth, Taluka Sonpeth (63 cases) and from village Parva, PHC Jamb, Taluka Parbhani (17 cases). District RRT visited to the affected villages. House to house survey doen for fever cases. Rapid fever survey done. Blood samples collected found negative for Malaria. Sera samples sent to Aurangabad for lab investigations; result awaited. On entomological survey, Aedes mosquito larvae found in some houses. Health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Fever cases occurred in village Nithar, Taluka Vair. Medical teams sent to the affected village and house to house fever survey conducted. Fogging done in the affected village. Blood slide of all fever cases examined was negative for malaria. Two blood samples tested negative for Dengue. IEC activities undertaken regarding personal protection measures.

Outbreak reported from S/C Narwana, PHC Siras Newai, and S/C Pachala, PHC Aligarh Uniara. Cases presented with fever with or without joint pain and headache. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. Water samples and blood samples collected for lab analysis; result awaited. House to house fever survey done. Health education given regarding sanitation and hygienic practices.

Outbreak of fever reported from village Nandhibatlu, PHC Lingadahalli, Taluka Tarikere. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 35 blood smears examined; all found negative for Malaria. All cases treated. House to house search done for fever cases. Health education given.

Outbreak reported from village Kotoli, Block Panhala. District RRT members visited the affected area. All cases treated symptomatically. House to house survey done for new fever cases. Fogging activities done. Health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Outbreak of fever reported from Khandegaon, PHC Hayatnabagr, Taluka Basmat. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. All cases treated symptomatically. Active search done for new fever cases. Health education given regarding hygiene and sanitation measures.

Outbreak reported from Butoli (Laxmangarh). District RRT visited the affected area, active surveillance and treatment done. Slide for MP taken 9; all found negative after testing. Health education given.

Cases of fever reported from Village Kundha Colony, Block/PHC Karamadai. 15 sera samples collected and sent to IVC & ZET, Hosur for lab testing gfor Dengue and Chikungunya; result awaited. Fogging, source reduction, and anti-larval measures undertaken. Health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Outbreak reported from Village Vikrampur, Block Khalwa. District RRT has visited affected area and active case search done for fever cases. Blood slides prepared for malaria; result awaited. All preventive and curative measures undertaken. Health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Cases occurred in village Sota Bhadurpur, Block Barpur. District RRT visited the affected area. Medical camp conducted in affected village and house to house survey done for new cases. All cases treated symptomatically. IEC activities undertaken regarding prevention of vector borne diseases.

C ases of fever reported from Village Nadura Khurd, Block Khaknar. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. Active search done for new fever cases. Health education given regarding hygiene, sanitation and personal protection measures.

Outbreak reported from Village/ PHC Thirupoondi, Block Keezhaiyur. 109 blood smears examined for Malaria found negative. 15 sera samples have been collected and sent to ZET, Trichy for analysis of Dengue and Chikungunya. Health education given to public regarding early treatment of cases and personal protection measures.

Cases of fever reported from Walmiki Nagar, PHC Devhare, Taluka Mangad. Entomological survey not done. IEC activities undertaken regarding hygienic practices, sanitation measures and emptying vacant containers lying around, insecticide spray for mosquito control and source reduction measures.

Outbreak of fever reported from Sumerpur, Mandhata. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. Mass fever survey done. Cases treated symptomatically. IEC activities undertaken regarding early treatment of cases and personal protection measures to be adopted by the community.

Outbreak reported from Swarupnagar (middle) sub-center area, near Swarupnagar United Club. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. 8 blood samples sent to STM, Kolkata for lab investigation; result awaited. Medical camp setup at Swarupnagar (Middle) sub center area. Active house to house survey by health staff. IEC activities undertaken regarding hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Outbreak reported from Swarupnagar (middle) subcentre area, near Swarupnagar United Club. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. 102 blood samples sent to STM, Kolkata for lab investigation; result awaited. Medical camp setup at Swarupnagar (Middle) subcentre area. Active house to house survey by health staff. IEC activities undertaken regarding hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Outbreak of fever reported from Village Jumatrai, PHC Gabat, Taluka Bayad. District RRT visited the affected area. Active surveillance done for new fever cases. Out of 82 blood slides collected from fever cases, all found negative for malaria. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given regarding hygiene and sanitation.

Outbreak reported from Swarupnagar (middle) sub-center area, near Swarupnagar United Club. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. 102 blood samples sent to STM, Kolkata for lab investigation; result awaited. Medical camp setup at Swarupnagar (Middle) subcentre area to treat cases. Active house to house survey by health staff. IEC activities undertaken regarding hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Outbreak reported from Swarupnagar (middle) sub-center area, near Swarupnagar United Club. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. 102 blood samples sent to STM, Kolkata for lab investigation; result awaited. Medical camp setup at Swarupnagar (Middle) subcentre area to treat cases. Active house to house survey done by health staff for fever cases. IEC and health education activities undertaken regarding hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Outbreak reported from Swarupnagar (middle) sub-center area, near Swarupnagar United Club. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. 102 blood samples sent to STM, Kolkata for lab investigation; result awaited. Medical camp setup at Swarupnagar (Middle) subcentre area to treat cases. Active house to house survey done by health staff for fever cases. IEC and health education activities undertaken regarding hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Outbreak reported from Swarupnagar (middle) sub-center area, near Swarupnagar United Club. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. 102 blood samples sent to STM, Kolkata for lab investigation; result awaited. Medical camp setup at Swarupnagar (Middle) subcentre area to treat cases. Active house to house survey done by health staff for fever cases. IEC and health education activities undertaken regarding hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Outbreak reported from Swarupnagar (middle) sub-center area, near Swarupnagar United Club. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. 147 blood samples sent to STM, Kolkata for lab investigation; result awaited. Medical camp setup at Swarupnagar (Middle) subcentre area to treat cases. Active house to house survey done by health staff for fever cases. IEC activities undertaken regarding hygienic practices and sanitation measures.

Outbreak of fever reported from Villages Bazarpara, Omorpur, and Bairampur, Ramnagar-I, II under Hanskhali Block of Ranaghat Subdiv. (37 cases); Vill Haripukuria, GP Fatepur under Haringhata Block of Kalyani SD (30 cases); and from Vill-Betai, Uttar Jitpur under Tehatta-I Block/SD (60 cases). Block level medical teams visited the area. All cases treated symptomatically and severely ill patients hospitalized. Sera samples collected and sent to NICED, Kolkata for Chikungunya and Dengue test; lab result awaited. Health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Outbreak of fever with joint pain reported from City Dispensary-2, Bikaner City. Water logging and high mosquito breeding observed in the area. Medical team deployed in the affected area to treat cases. 260 blood slides collected for MP test. Active survey by house to house visit done by medical team to find new fever cases. Mass fever survey and entomological surveillance done. Fogging activities and source reduction measures undertaken in and around the affected area. IEC activities undertaken regarding adopting personal protection measures.

Outbreak reported from Village Bhai, PHC Lalita Mudia, Tahsil Weir, Block Bhusawar. District RRT visited affected village with medical teams from Block and PHC level. Door to door fever survey conducted. Water storage containers checked and fogging, anti-larval activity also conducted. 8 sera samples collected and sent to Central Lab SMS Hospital, Jaipur; result awaited. Health education given to the villagers regarding personal protection measures.

Cases reported from Village Mundiampakkam Colony, PHC Thumbur, Block Vikkiravandi. District RRT visited the affected area. 4 serum samples collected and sent to ZET Cuddalore; results awaited. Fever surveillance done. Health education given.

Outbreak reported from Vill-Maniknagar, GP Gayeshpur, Santipur Block, Ranaghat SD. Block level medical team visited the affected area. All cases treated symptomatically. Severely ill patients hospitalized at Kanla SGH. 5 serum samples collected and sent to NICED, Kolkata for Chikungunya and Dengue test; lab result awaited. Health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Outbreak of fever reported from Village Padavali, SHC Retorkala, CHC Noorbad, Gangapurbhatori, SHC Datehra. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. All blood smears examined found negative for malaria. Paramedical staff deputed to the affected area for active surveillance. Mass fever survey done. Anti-larval activities undertaken in and around the affected areas. IEC activities undertaken regarding early treatment of cases and personal protection measures to be adopted by the community.

Outbreak of fever reported from Villages Sakedi Boudhwadi, Varawade, Hiwalwadi, Kalmath, Kumbharwadi under Kankavli Taluka. Rapid fever survey done in the affected area. Blood samples sent for lab investigation; result awaited. Entomological survey done in the area by house to house visit. Larvicides applied and fogging activities done in the affected areas. Health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Outbreak of fever with joint pain reported from city dispensary-2, Bikaner city. Water logging and high mosquito breeding observed in the area. Medical team deployed in the affected area to treat cases. House to house visit done by medical team to find new fever cases. Entomological survey done. Fogging activities and source reduction measures undertaken. IEC activities undertaken regarding adopting personal protection measures.

Outbreak reported from Village Nangla Kokila, PHC Bahaj, Tehsil/Block Deeg. District RRT visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. Blood slides found negative for Malaria. High density of Aedes aegypti mosquito breeding found in the area. Mass fever survey and entomological surveillance done. Fogging activities and source reduction measures undertaken in and around the affected village. IEC activities undertaken regarding early treatment of cases and personal protection measures to be adopted by the community.

Cases reported from village Vadamalapuram, PHC M.Pudupatti, Block Sivakasi. Paramedical staff deputed to the affected area for active surveillance. Mass fever survey done. Fogging activities and source reduction measures undertaken in and around the affected village. IEC activities undertaken regarding early treatment of cases.

Outbreak reported from Village Golpura, PHC Dahara, Taluka Kumher. District RRT and PHC level medical team visited the affected area. 11 Serum samples collected for Chikungunya test and sent to Central Lab, SMS Hospital, Jaipur. Blood slides of all fever cases tested negative for Malaria Parasite. High density of Aedes aegypti breeding seen in the affected area. Door to door fever survey and entomological survey done. Fogging and anti larval activities also conducted. Health education given to villagers regarding preventive and control measures to be undertaken.

Cases of fever, joint pain/swelling and rash reported from Khajurdihi GP, Panuhat Sub centre and Mondalhat Sub centre. District RRT along with BMOH visited the affected area. Blood samples collected and sent to STM, Kolkata for lab investigation; result awaited. Vector control measures like fogging, anti-larvicide application, etc. undertaken. Symptomatic treatment of cases done. IEC activities undertaken regarding early treatment of cases and personal protection measures to be adopted by the community.

Outbreak reported from Village Barbani, Block Unhel. District RRT visited the affected area. Sera samples sent for lab investigation; result awaited. Cases treated symptomatically. Mass fever survey done. IEC activities undertaken regarding early treatment of cases and personal protective measures to be adopted by the community.

Outbreak of fever, joint pain and rash reported from Ukhura, Jogeswar village, Ukhura SC, Purbastali II Block. Medical team along with Epidemiologist investigated the outbreak and conducted active surveillance for new cases with fever and joint pain. All cases treated symptomatically. Source reduction measures and fogging activities undertaken. IEC activities undertaken regarding personal protective measures.

Cases reported from Village Sukripada, HSC Pateta, Block Barajamda, District West Singhbhum. Cases presented with fever, headache and body pain. Affected area is a malaria endemic zone. All 64 cases were tested for malaria & COVID-19, out of which only one sample was positive for Falciparum Malaria by Rapid Diagnostic test kit and all were found negative for COVID-19. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Health education was given.
Cases reported from Village Basdilla Kurde. CHC Tarya. District RRT investigated outbreak. House to house survey done. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.the

Outbreak reported from Village Aloda, SC Ittamgaon, PHC Loni Warud, and Block Warud. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 3 serum samples collected which tested negative for Dengue. IEC activities undertaken regarding personal protection

Outbreak reported from Vishwabharathi High School, Village Barakanahal, PHC Kandikere, Taluk C.N.Halli. District RRT with Medical Officer, PHC Kandikere, visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. Blood samples sent for testing for Malaria, Dengue, Chikungunya and Enteric fever; result awaited. Fogging, larva surveillance, daily fever surveillance undertaken. Active survey done to find new cases. Mobile clinic set up to treat cases. IEC activities undertaken regarding personal protection measures.

Outbreak reported from Village Gopathanda, Subcentre Peddanagaram, PHC Danthalapally, Block Thorrur, District Warangal. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey carried out for finding new cases. Serum samples were negative for Chikungunya and Dengue. Blood smears were negative for Malaria parasite. Fogging and daily fever surveillance undertaken. IEC activities undertaken regarding personal protection measures.

Outbreak reported from Village Bavadiya, Block Thikri, District Burwani. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house search for fever cases done. All cases treated symptomatically. 7 serum samples collected and sent to Indore Medical College, Indore which tested negative for Chikungunya by IgM ELISA. Abate application and anti adult measures like fogging activities done. IEC done regarding personal protection.

Cases reported from Village Gamireddygaripalli, SC Y. Pasalavandlapalli, PHC Gurramkonda, District Chittoor. Medical team investigated the outbreak. Medical camp organized in the affected area. House to house survey done. All cases treated.

Outbreak reported from Village Sanchali, SC Semad, PHC Sayara, Block Gogunda, District Udaipur. District RRT investigated the outbreak. 21 blood slides collected which tested negative for Malaria. House to house survey done. Symptomatic treatment provided to all cases. Chlorination done. IEC done.

Outbreak reported from Village Jodubaithanda, SC Neardugomma, PHC Chandampet, Block Veerlagudam, Nalgonda. District RRT investigated the outbreak. All 77 blood smears collected were negative for malaria parasite. Abate application, spraying and fogging done in the affected village. Health education given.

Outbreak reported from Village & SC MadavaYedavelly, PHC Narketpally Block and District Nalgonda. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Temporary medical camps organized. All 35 blood smears collected were negative for malaria parasite. Health education given.

Outbreak reported from Village Kothagudem, SC B. Vellemla, PHC Narkatpally, Block and District Nalgonda. Medical team investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 34 blood smears collected were negative for malaria parasite. 8 blood serum samples collected were negative for Dengue (Ig M ELISA). Abate application, spraying and fogging done in the affected village. Health education given.
Cases reported from Village/PHC/CHC Venoor, Taluk Belthangady. District RRT investigated the outbreak. Cases presented with fever, fatigue, pain abdomen and headache. Asymptoms of
house survey done. 6 blood sample collected and sent General Hospital symptomatically. Health education given.
house survey done. 6 blood sample collected and sent General Hospital symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Darsi, Block Thalluru, PHC/SC Madhavaram. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 04 Blood Samples collected and sent to RIMS, result awaited. 02 Water samples tested at DPHL, Ongole were found non-potable. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Thoyana, PHC Ranakandorana, Taluka Ranavav. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Out of 08 serum sample collected and sent to GGH Medical College, Jamnagar; 03 samples were positive for dengue (IgM ELISA). All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Government Girl Hostel, CHC Joura. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Affected cases are 9-14 years of age. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village/SHC Jaswada, Block M. Barodia. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 10 samples tested for Malaria found negative. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village/PHC Enthar, Block Ater. District  RRT  investigated  the  outbreak.  House  to  house  survey  done.  Majority of cases were in 06 to 19 years  of age group. All 17  PBS found negative for MP. All cases treated symptomatically.  Health education given.

Cases reported from SC Daulipau, PHC Natwar Nagar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 120 Blood samples tested at Malaria Lab DMO Office, found negative for malaria. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Kaudgaon, PHC Devgaon, Block Ahmednagar. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 26 PBS tested negative for MP and all 05 Serum samples tested negative for Dengue. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Tiloda, PHC Nayakpura, CHC Noorabad. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 62PBS examined at GRMC, Gwalior, were found negative for MP. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Village Jaderu SCH Kanhar CHC Pahadgarh. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. Out of 22 blood slides samples tested at GRMC Gwalior, 01 sample found positive for Malaria (plasmodium falciparum). All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Casesreported from Village Karari Sector Datehra CHC Noorabad, District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 83 blood slides tested negative for Malaria at GRMC Gwalior All 07 Samples tested negative for dengue IgM. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases reported from Taluk Patoda, PHC Naigaon, Block Daskhed. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. All 05 Serum samples tested at DPL Beed, found negative for dengue and chikungunya. All cases treated symptomatically. Source reduction activities undertaken. Health education given. Deceased was 03 year old female child.

Cases reported from Village Ramanalavari Palem, SC Boddikurapadu, PHC/Mandal Thalluru. District RRT investigated the outbreak. House to house survey done. 21 Blood serum samples collected and sent to RIMS Priority Lab, Ongole; Result awaited. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given.

Cases presented with fever in Melvanakkampadi village, Elangunni PHC. Medical team formed and fever surveillance work done. Serum samples sent to SE.ZET, Vellore; lab result awaited. Fogging and source reduction activities done. IEC activities done.

Outbreak reported from Ward no. 14, Kangokpi Block and CHC. RRT investigation done. 129 blood samples collected and tested for malaria and enteric fever (Widal test); all reports were negative. Further investigations being done to ascertain the cause. IEC activities done.

Outbreak of fever reported from Arasaur village, Ukkaram PHC, Block Sathy.. Investigation done by District RRT. Fever surveillance done. IEC activities undertaken. Samples sent for lab analysis to Medical College, Coimbatore; result awaited.

Outbreak reported from Perunlia village, Perunila PHC with cases presenting with fever, headache, cough and myalgia. All cases treated symptomatically and preventive measures undertaken like source reduction, larval density monitoring, water chlorination, etc. Dist RRT investigation done. Water and sera samples sent to KAP, Viswanathan Medical College, Trichy for lab investigation; result awaited.

Outbreak occurred in Luci Lutey village. The District Surveillance Officer with PHC medical officers investigated the outbreak. Poor hygienic conditions and overcrowding observed in community. Symptomatic treatment given to all cases. Health education given and IEC activities done regarding hygiene and sanitation measures.
Under Control

Cases reported from village Bauunihalda, Block Kotabagh. District RRT visited the area. Blood slides and sera samples sent to lab for analysis; reports awaited. Critical cases admitted and treated at local hospital. Mass fever survey done. Focal spray of DDT been undertaken by local health authority. Health education given.
Cases with fever reported from Pipli village, PHC Thakurdwara. Investigation done by dist RRT. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given regarding sanitation and hygienic practices.

Cases of fever reported from Karuthigoundanpatty village, Block Vedasandur, PHC Kovilur. District RRT visited the affected village. Serum samples sent to Rajai Hospital, Madurai; result awaited. Survey done for new fever cases. All cases treated symptomatically. Health education given regarding hygiene and personal sanitation measures.

Cases reported from Rosanampatti village, M.Subulapuram PHC with symptoms of fever, cough, head ache and body ache. Blood samples collected and sent to Madurai Medical College for investigation of Chikungunya, Dengue, Leptospirosis and Typhoid. General sanitation improved and health education given to the villagers.

All cases are school children from Jhakhar Wala village, with symptoms like fever, running nose, sore throat and body aches. All cases treated symptomatically. School closed for three days and IEC activities undertaken in the community regarding sanitation and hygienic practices.

Cases of fever reported from Khaira block. Mass fever survey done. Examination of blood smears from fever cases found negative for malaria. All cases treated symptomatically. IEC activities undertaken regarding personal protection measures.

Cases of fever and cough reported from Kanigiri Major panchayat area of Devanga nagar. Blood samples collected for lab analysis. All cases treated symptomatically. District Rapid Response Team (RRT) visited the affected area and investigated the outbreak. Health education given regarding hygiene, sanitation and personal protection measures.

Outbreak reported from Jawahar Navoday Vidyalaya, Landiguda with children suffering from high grade fever, cough, throat congestion, headache and body ache. Four cases having high fever advised hospitalization at District Hospital, Koraput. Out of 88 Rapid Diagnostic Tests done for malaria, only one found positive for P.falciparum. District RRT headed by the AHO visited the school and took preventive and curative measures. Health education given regarding hygiene, sanitation and personal protection measures.

Cases reported from Kadayam village, PHC Karuvatchi, Block Kedar. District RRT visited the affected area. Serum samples collected and sent for investigation, result awaited. All cases treated. Chlorination and disinfection of water sources done. IEC activities undertaken and health education given regarding sanitation and hygienic practices.

Cases reported from Korikulam village, PHC Kasavalanadupudur District RRT visited the affected area. Chlorination and disinfection of water sources done. Health education given regarding sanitation and hygienic practices.

Cases reported from Appasamy Nagar Village, PHC Marungulam, Block Thanjavur. Clinically the cases appear to be cases of viral fever. Health supervisors visiting the area more frequently and IEC sessions undertaken to aware people about the nature of the illness.

Outbreak occurred in Chowhuri Para and Benerjal Para areas of Makardah gram panchyaet, Domjur Block. District RRT alongwith medical officers of Block hospital visited the area investigated and treated cases. Blood samples collected and tested in STM (School of Tropical Medicine), found PF negative. Clinically symptoms are like that of viral fever. House to house survey going on for detection of new cases. Health education given to community regarding the nature and management of cases at home.

Cases reported from Ulagalampoondi village, PHC Thumbur, Block Vikkiravandi (16 cases) and Ural Villlage, PHC Saram, Block Olakkur (16 cases). District RRT visited the affected areas. Sera samples sent to Mailam Lab for Leptospirosis investigation and to King Institute Chennai for Dengue and Chikungunya investigation; result awaited. Fever surveillance carried out, IEC activities undertaken. Fogging and anti- larval activities carried out. Patients treated symptomatically.

Cases reported from Reflapalli Village, PHC Moksha Gundam. Medical officers and para-medical health workers visited the area, held medical camp and conducted conducted house to house survey for new cases. Cases clinically appeared to be viral fever or seasonal flu cases and tested negative for malaria.

Outbreak reported from village Sengamedu, Block Mugalyur, PHC Kandachipuram, Villupuram–Kallakurichi. District RRT visited the affected area. 44 blood smears collected are being examined at PHC. 9 sera samples collected and sent to ZET, Trichy; result awaited. Cases treated symptomatically. Door to door surveillance done for new cases. Source reduction and anti larval work done. IEC activities undertaken.

Outbreak reported from Village S.Ganapathipalayam, PHC Kugalur, Gobi Block. District RRT visited the affected area. Six sera samples sent to Senior Entomologist, ZET (Zonal Entomological Team), Coimbatore; result awaited. Medical team formed and fever surveillance done in the area. Fogging operation done, source reduction done. IEC activities undertaken.

All cases are children in the age-group of 6-12 years, from a school in village Baduwal, under CHC Kot Ise Khan. District RRT visited the affected area. House to house survey conducted in affected village to search for new fever cases. Blood smears prepared to rule out malaria and blood samples collected for other investigations. Symptomatic treatment given to all cases. Health education given by survey team.

Outbreak reported from villages MGR Nagar (RSMangalam PHC: 75 cases), and Keelamunthal (PHC Valinokkam: 45 cases). Aedes mosquito breeding sites identified in the area (House index = 34.6, Container index= 15.7). District RRT visited the affected area to investigate the outbreak. 18 serum samples collected from the affected people and sent to the IVCZ, Hosur. Abate application done in water sources. Health education given regarding personal protection measures.

Outbreak reported from village Govindhavadi Agaram, PHC Parandur, Block Walajabad. District RRT visited the affected area. Blood samples collected from fever cases found negative for Malaria. 13 sera samples sent to ZET, Vellore for analysis; result awaited. Door to door surveillance done for fever cases. Symptomatic treatment given to all cases. Fogging, Temephos application and other mosquito control activities carried out. IEC activities undertaken.

Outbreak reported from Village Thirupanjeeli, Block Manachanallur, PHC Sirugambur. District RRT visited the affected area. 48 blood smears examined for malaria found negative. 15 sera samples collected from cases of fever and sent to KAPV Medical College for analysis of Chikungunya and Dengue; result awaited. Fogging operation and anti-larval operations conducted. Health education given to the public to prevent mosquito breeding in the affected area.

Outbreak reported from Village Mandapasalai, PHC M.Reddiapatti, Block Thiruchuli,. District RRT visited the affected village. Medical team posted in the area for treatment of cases. Four sera samples sent to the Senior Entomologist, ZET, Virudhunagar for testing for Chikungunya, Dengue and Leptospirosis. Daily fever survey conducted in the area. Anti larval measures undertaken including source reduction by application of Abate to all available breeding sources. IEC activities undertaken.

Outbreak reported from Village Mudkhed, Sub Centre Khoras, PHC Chatori, Taluka Palam. 25 blood slides collected tested negative for malaria. Six blood samples sent to Aurangabad for further investigation; result awaited. Rapid fever survey and entomological survey done in the affected area and 5 km around the area. Fogging operation done by District Malaria Officer and team. IEC activities undertaken.
